original: pra ka ra na bing sha ka t'i k'a /

original: bod skad du /

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel bshad /

translated: Commentary on the Twenty Verses

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: gang thugs thugs rje rag las phyir //
analyzed: gang thugs thugs rje rag las phyir //
translated: To you whose mind is moved by compassion,

original: gzhan gyi don la rtag dgyes pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la rtag dgyes pa //
translated: who always delight in others' welfare,

original: mi shes bcom la phyag 'tshal @172a * //
analyzed: mi shes bcom la phyag 'tshal @172a * //
translated: I pay homage, O destroyer of ignorance.

original: lo ; / nyi shu pa ni rnam par dbye //
analyzed: lo ; / nyi shu pa ni rnam par dbye //
translated: The twentieth is the analysis.

original: theg pa chen po la khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dngos su ston to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dngos su ston to //
translated: By the first phrase, The Mahāyāna is presented as mere representation of the three realms, the purpose of this chapter, the nature of the subject matter, and the ultimate purpose are directly taught.

original: 'brel pa ni don gyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni don gyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: The connection should be understood by implication.

original: rab tu byed pa'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams nges par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams nges par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The connection of the chapter, the subject matter, and the purpose should be stated.

original: gzhan du na 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang / dgos pa med pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i nyan pa po dag khas mi len te //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang / dgos pa med pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i nyan pa po dag khas mi len te //
translated: Otherwise, the treatise would have no connection, no subject matter, no purpose, and no ultimate purpose, and no one would accept it, since it would be a mere fantasy.

original: de la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the word “Great Vehicle” indicates the ultimate purpose.

original: khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag ces bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the three realms are established as mind-only” indicates the subject matter and the purpose.

original: 'dir khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid lung dang rigs pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid lung dang rigs pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: Here, the three realms are mind-only is taught by means of scripture and reasoning.

original: 'di ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the subject matter.

original: khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bstan pa ni dgos pa'o //🔽bstan pa de yang rab tu dbye bas byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bstan pa ni dgos pa'o // bstan pa de yang rab tu dbye bas byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The teaching that the three realms are mind-only is the purpose.🔽And that teaching is accomplished by means of analysis.

original: rab tu byed pa ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
translated: The treatise is the means to that purpose.

original: de bas na rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.

analyzed: de ltar gnas pa la brgya la 'ga' zhig khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa 'dis ni ci zhig bya zhes rgol du 'ong bas de'i phyir / theg pa chen po zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
translated: In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.

original: de las ni khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bstan pa ni thag pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /🔽'di ni re zhig spyi'i don no //
analyzed: de las ni khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du bstan pa ni thag pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste / 'di ni re zhig spyi'i don no //
translated: In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba 'dis 'dong pas na theg pa'o //🔽yang na 'dir 'dod pas na theg pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba 'dis 'dong pas na theg pa'o // yang na 'dir 'dod pas na theg pa'o //
translated: In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.

original: de'i theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po'o //
translated: In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is the goal and the former is the means for attaining it.🔽In this way, the chapter and the purpose are related in the sense that the latter is

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the path of the bodhisattva together with its result is called the Great Vehicle.

original: chen po ni de ma yin pa'i theg pa gzhan pas mchog tu gyur par rig @172b par bya'o /
analyzed: chen po ni de ma yin pa'i theg pa gzhan pas mchog tu gyur par rig @172b par bya'o /
translated: The Great Vehicle is to be understood as the highest of all vehicles.

original: 'di ltar der ni gang zag la bdag med par shes pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar der ni gang zag la bdag med par shes pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spong ba'o //
translated: For, in the latter, the obscuration of the afflictions is abandoned by the knowledge of the selflessness of the person.

original: 'dir ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'o //
translated: Here, the obscuration of the afflictions and the knowable are abandoned by the knowledge of the selflessness of the person and phenomena.

original: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa'i phyir chen po ste /
analyzed: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa'i phyir chen po ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is great because it possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness are with regard to object, practice, knowledge, effort, skillful means, complete accomplishment, and activity.

original: la ni 'dir rgyu'i don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: la ni 'dir rgyu'i don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of “great” should be understood as the meaning of “cause.”

original: theg pa chen po'i rgyu theg pa chen po thob par byed pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rgyu theg pa chen po thob par byed pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause of the Great Vehicle is the meaning of “to obtain the Great Vehicle.”

original: 'di ltar 'dul ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dul ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two kinds of disciples:

original: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag dang / chos la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag go //🔽de la gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag gi ni de bstan pa la brten nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba phung po tsam du shes nas thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag dang / chos la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag go // de la gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba dag gi ni de bstan pa la brten nas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba phung po tsam du shes nas thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis
translated: those who are disciplined by the teaching of selflessness with regard to persons and those who are disciplined by the teaching of selflessness with regard to things.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug go //
translated: Those who are disciplined by the teaching of selflessness with regard to persons, having understood that the mere aggregates are devoid of self and what belongs to self, and are subject to origination and destruction, on the basis of that teaching, enter into the selflessness of persons through the stages of hearing, reflection, and the like.

original: bdag med pa la 'jug pa des nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral nas mthar phyin pa'i gnas 'thob ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa la 'jug pa des nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral nas mthar phyin pa'i gnas 'thob ste /
translated: By entering into selflessness, they become free from the obscurations of the afflictions and attain the state of culmination.

original: de dag gi de'i thabs bstan pa ni gzhan nas brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi de'i thabs bstan pa ni gzhan nas brjod pa nyid do //
translated: The teaching of the means for that is stated elsewhere.

original: gang dag chos la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba de dag ni de bstan pa la brten nas chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i bstan bcos nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i
analyzed: gang dag chos la bdag med par bstan pas 'dul ba de dag ni de bstan pa la brten nas chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i bstan bcos nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i
translated: Those who are disciplined by the teaching of selflessness in phenomena, by relying on that teaching, gradually enter into the realm of phenomena through listening to and reflecting on the treatises that are consistent with the realization of the realm of phenomena, and so on, in order to destroy the notions of object and subject.

original: phyir ro // rab tu byed pa 'dis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig ba'i thabs nyid ston to //
analyzed: phyir ro // rab tu byed pa 'dis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig ba'i thabs nyid ston to //
translated: This chapter shows just the method for destroying the notions of object and subject.

original: rnam par bshig nas gzung pa dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par bshig nas gzung pa dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug go //
translated: Having destroyed them, one enters into mere consciousness, free from object and subject.

original: de nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma lus par bsal nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs te /
analyzed: de nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma lus par bsal nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs te /
translated: Then, by accomplishing the stages and perfections, having completely removed both object and subject, one realizes the realm of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang bla na med pa 'thob pas de la bsams nas theg pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang bla na med pa 'thob pas de la bsams nas theg pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: Thinking of that, it is explained: “In order to attain the Great Vehicle.”

original: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba dag ste /🔽gsum po nyid khams yin pas @173a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba dag ste / gsum po nyid khams yin pas @173a * //
translated: The three realms are called the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.🔽The three realms are the realms.

original: khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the realms.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The mind and mental factors that are not free from attachment to the desire realm are the desire realm.

original: gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: Those that are free from attachment to the desire realm

original: gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: but not free from attachment to form are the form realm.

original: gang dag gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral la gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gang dag gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral la gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: Those that are free from attachment to form but not free from attachment to the formless are the formless realm.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Mere representation means being free from objects.

original: 'ba' zhig pas rnam par rig pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pas rnam par rig pa tsam ste /
translated: It is mere representation because it is solitary.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the mind and mental factors that are free from grasped and grasper.

original: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The term “is posited” means “is taught.”

original: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag nyid la khams gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes ston te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag nyid la khams gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes ston te /
translated: This passage teaches that the three realms are posited in terms of mind and mental factors alone.

original: dper na / gzugs med kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / gzugs med kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like the fact that the base consisting of infinite space and so on are posited as distinct even though they are formless.

original: yang na theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni yul gyi la ste /
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni yul gyi la ste /
translated: Alternatively, the term “in the Mahayana” means “in the object.”

original: des theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage teaches that the scriptures called the Mahayana are mere representations.

original: lhag ma'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The explanation of the remainder is the same as before.

original: de las ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la khams gsum pa rnam par gzhag pa rig pa tsam nyid du dam 'cha'o zhe'am 'dogs so zhe bya ba'i tha tshig gi don 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i gsung rab la khams gsum pa rnam par gzhag pa rig pa tsam nyid du dam 'cha'o zhe'am 'dogs so zhe bya ba'i tha tshig gi don 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: This passage means that the three realms are posited in the scriptures called the Mahayana as mere representations.

original: bshad pa 'di la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa la sogs pa dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa la sogs pa dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this explanation, the purpose of the purpose is the destruction of the apprehended and apprehender, and so on.

original: theg pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir lung dang rigs pa gnyis kyis khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du de bstan zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir lung dang rigs pa gnyis kyis khams gsum pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du de bstan zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: In order to attain the Great Vehicle, the three realms are taught to be only cognition by both scripture and reasoning.

original: re zhig lung gis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig lung gis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, in order to demonstrate this by means of scripture,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says, “O sons of the Victorious One, this three-realm world…” and so forth.

original: yang na bshad pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas theg pa chen po la rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges zhes rgol ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na bshad pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas theg pa chen po la rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges zhes rgol ba de'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, in terms of the second explanation, it is argued, “How is it certain that the Great Vehicle is taught to be only cognition?”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “O sons of the Victorious One, this three-realm world…” and so forth.

original: mdo sde las ni khams gsum pa @173b mtha' dag sems tsam mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las ni khams gsum pa @173b mtha' dag sems tsam mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the sutras, the entire three realms are said to be mind only.

original: gzugs dang mi ldan pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni rnam par shes pa las logs shig na med la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mi ldan pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni rnam par shes pa las logs shig na med la /
translated: Form is not separate from consciousness, nor is the unconditioned.🔽And there is no subject-object dichotomy.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang med do zhes dgongs pa'o //🔽rang gi sde pa dag la re zhig lung 'di'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang med do zhes dgongs pa'o // rang gi sde pa dag la re zhig lung 'di'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.🔽To those of our own Buddhist schools who rely on scripture, we say this:

original: gang dag gzhung gzhan la gnas pa de dag la ni rigs pa brjod do //
analyzed: gang dag gzhung gzhan la gnas pa de dag la ni rigs pa brjod do //
translated: To those who rely on reasoning, we say this:

original: lung ni mchod pa dang / brjod pa nyung ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du gzhag par rigs so //
analyzed: lung ni mchod pa dang / brjod pa nyung ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du gzhag par rigs so //
translated: It is proper to posit scripture first, because it is the means of knowing that is most easily understood.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi phyogs la sgra'am ming gi tshogs la sogs pa med du zin kyang tshig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi phyogs la sgra'am ming gi tshogs la sogs pa med du zin kyang tshig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lung ste /
translated: Even though the collection of words and so on do not exist in the position of vijñaptimātra, the consciousness of words and so on is scripture.

original: 'di ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'gro ba'i bla ma'i dbang las byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'gro ba'i bla ma'i dbang las byung ste /
translated: It arises from the power of the guru of the world, who possesses the qualities of seeing things as they are and so on.

original: de lta bas na gzhan las 'ongs pa'i phyir lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan las 'ongs pa'i phyir lung zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it comes from another, it is called scripture.

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'di nges par khas blang par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'di nges par khas blang par bya ste /
translated: And others must also accept this.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i spyi nyid tshig yin gyi sgra'i bye brag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i spyi nyid tshig yin gyi sgra'i bye brag ni ma yin no //
translated: For the universal of sound is a word, not a particular of sound.

original: sgra'i spyi de yang shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i spyi de yang shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha yin te /
translated: And that universal of sound is the objective aspect of consciousness.

original: gud na dngos por gyur pa med do //
analyzed: gud na dngos por gyur pa med do //
translated: It does not exist as a real entity apart from that.

original: de bas na sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa'i shes pa nyid lung zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa'i shes pa nyid lung zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of the universal aspect of sound is itself called scripture.

original: 'dir ni rnam par rig pa tsam du dam bca' la /
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par rig pa tsam du dam bca' la /
translated: Here, the thesis is that there is representation-only.

original: mdo sde las ni sems tsam zhes 'byung na de ni ji ltar khungs su rung snyam du dogs pa de la /
analyzed: mdo sde las ni sems tsam zhes 'byung na de ni ji ltar khungs su rung snyam du dogs pa de la /
translated: But in the sutra, it says “mind-only.” How can that be a valid source?

original: sems dang yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems dang yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To answer that, he says, “Mind, thought, and consciousness. . . .”

original: 'di ni phan tshun du don 'brel ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun du don 'brel ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: These are not unrelated to each other.

original: 'di ltar sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rnam grangs su gtogs so //
translated: For mind, thought, consciousness, and representation are synonyms.

original: rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The term “without a separate cause” is a synonym.

original: 'di ltar rim zhes bya ba rnam grangs kyi don de ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim zhes bya ba rnam grangs kyi don de ston to //
translated: Thus, the term “order” is a synonym for “series.”

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa bzhi brjod pa ni gsung rab kyi tha snyad la mgo rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa bzhi brjod pa ni gsung rab kyi tha snyad la mgo rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The four synonyms are mentioned in order to avoid confusion about the terminology of the scriptures.

original: gang rab tu byed pa 'di las rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa dang / gang yang mdo sde las sems zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad bsdus so //
analyzed: gang rab tu byed pa 'di las rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa dang / gang yang mdo sde las sems zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad bsdus so //
translated: The term “representation” in this chapter and the term “mind” in the scriptures refer to the eight consciousnesses.🔽The following passage does not contradict this explanation:

original: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste zhes 'og nas 'byung ba yang de dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste zhes 'og nas 'byung ba yang de dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: The consciousness itself appears as the perceived part.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag don du snang bar 'dod do //🔽gal te khams gsum pa @174a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag don du snang bar 'dod do // gal te khams gsum pa @174a * //
translated: The reason is that the eight collections of consciousness are held to be the appearance of the perceived part.🔽If the three realms are mind only,

original: sems 'ba' zhig tsam yin na /
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig tsam yin na /
translated: why did the Buddha say that🔽they are born of karma?

original: 'o na ni sems las byung ba rnams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur du dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni sems las byung ba rnams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur du dogs pa la /
translated: But then it would follow that mental factors would also be nonexistent.

original: sems de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Fearing that, he says, “That mind also…”

original: khams gsum pa gdags pa'i rgyu sems gang yin pa de mdo sde las mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa gdags pa'i rgyu sems gang yin pa de mdo sde las mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The mind that is the cause of designating the three realms is considered in the sutras to be associated with mental factors.

original: yang na mdo sde las sems zhes smos pa gang yin pa de rab tu byed pa 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par lta'o //
analyzed: yang na mdo sde las sems zhes smos pa gang yin pa de rab tu byed pa 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par lta'o //
translated: Or, that which is called “mind” in the sutras is considered here in the treatise to be associated with mental factors.

original: sems de yang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa gdags pa'i rgyu'am mdo sde las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems de yang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa gdags pa'i rgyu'am mdo sde las 'byung ba'o //
translated: “That mind” refers to the cause of designating the three realms or that which occurs in the sutras.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: “Here” refers to the sutras or the treatise.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag dang sems su mtshungs par ldan pas mtshungs par ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag dang sems su mtshungs par ldan pas mtshungs par ldan pa dag ste /
translated: “Associated with mental factors” means that these are associated with the mind.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as feeling and so on.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pas na mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o//🔽dgongs zhes bya ba ni khas len to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pas na mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o// dgongs zhes bya ba ni khas len to //
translated: It is associated because it operates together with the associated factors.🔽The word “intends” means “accepts.”

original: 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ni 'di skad du khams gsum pa 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ni 'di skad du khams gsum pa 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam yin gyi /
translated: It means “accepts.”

original: sems 'ba' zhig tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: “This threefold realm is mind only, not just mind alone.”

original: sems zhes bya ba ni gsung rab las sems las byung ba dag la yang bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni gsung rab las sems las byung ba dag la yang bya ste /
translated: In the scriptures, the word “mind” is also used to refer to the mental factors.

original: 'di ltar sems btul na legs zhes byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems btul na legs zhes byung ste /
translated: For example, it says, “When the mind is tamed, all is tamed.”

original: sems las byung ba yang mi btul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba yang mi btul ba ma yin no //
translated: But the mental factors are not untamed.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid // ces gsungs te /
translated: This world is led by mind.

original: tshor ba dang sred pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyis khrid pa yang yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang sred pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyis khrid pa yang yin no //
translated: It is led by the mental factors such as sensation and craving.

original: gal te sems las byung ba dag kyang khas len na ci'i phyir tsam zhes bya ba smos snyam du dogs pa de la /🔽tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te sems las byung ba dag kyang khas len na ci'i phyir tsam zhes bya ba smos snyam du dogs pa de la / tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To address this doubt, he says,

original: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i don dgag pa'i phyir smos kyi /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i don dgag pa'i phyir smos kyi /
translated: “The term ‘mere’ is used to refute an object that is separate from consciousness.”

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: The term “mere” is used to refute an object that is separate from consciousness, but it is not used to refute mental factors.

original: don dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ni 'di skad du rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzung ba gang yang med la /
analyzed: don dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ni 'di skad du rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzung ba gang yang med la /
translated: “To refute an object” means to refute an object that has the nature of a perceived or a perceiver that is separate from consciousness.🔽This is what he is saying: There is no perceived object at all that is separate from consciousness.

original: @174b gang gis rnam par shes pa de la 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa yang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @174b gang gis rnam par shes pa de la 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa yang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And there is no perceiver that is a perceiver of that consciousness.

original: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don med na 'o na sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'di ci zhig / gang gis snang snyam du dogs pa de la rnam par shes pa 'di nyid du snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so
analyzed: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don med na 'o na sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'di ci zhig / gang gis snang snyam du dogs pa de la rnam par shes pa 'di nyid du snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so
translated: To this he says, “It is just consciousness appearing as that.”

original: // spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: // spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ngo //
translated: By the power of the complete maturation of the latent impressions of conceptualization, consciousness itself arises in the aspect of an object, such as blue.

original: de lta bur gyur pa byung ba de la srog chags logs shig na yod pa'i don zhig mthong ngo snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal du gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa byung ba de la srog chags logs shig na yod pa'i don zhig mthong ngo snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal du gyur to //
translated: That which arises in that way is the appearance of an object that exists separately from the living being, and the pride “I see” arises.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de snang ba na nam mkha'i khams dang lhan cig tu snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de snang ba na nam mkha'i khams dang lhan cig tu snang ngo //
translated: When the aspect of blue, etc. appears in this way, it appears together with the element of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams de snang ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang de las ris su chad pa lta bur snang bar byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams de snang ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang de las ris su chad pa lta bur snang bar byed do //
translated: When that element of space appears, it appears as if it were separate from the consciousness of blue, etc.

original: dper na me long gi ngos la zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba na nam mkha'i khams gzugs brnyan dang lhan cig tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na me long gi ngos la zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba na nam mkha'i khams gzugs brnyan dang lhan cig tu 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, when the reflection of the moon appears on the surface of a mirror, the space element appears together with the reflection.

original: nam mkha'i khams de der gzugs brnyan du gyur pa na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de me long gi ngos de las ris su chad de khron pa'i nang du lhung ba bzhin du snang bar byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams de der gzugs brnyan du gyur pa na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de me long gi ngos de las ris su chad de khron pa'i nang du lhung ba bzhin du snang bar byed do //
translated: When that space element becomes a reflection there, the orb of the moon appears as if it were cut off from that surface of the mirror and fallen into the well.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la nam mkha'i khams snang ba na yang ris su chad pa lta bur sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la nam mkha'i khams snang ba na yang ris su chad pa lta bur sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, when the space element appears in consciousness, it appears in the aspect of blue, etc., as if it were cut off.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ris su chad pa lta bu de la brten nas srog chags rnams phyi rol gyi don zhig mthong ba snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ris su chad pa lta bu de la brten nas srog chags rnams phyi rol gyi don zhig mthong ba snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
translated: Based on that appearance of blue, etc., as if it were cut off, living beings produce the conceit that they see an external object.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says:

original: dper na rab rib can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, those with eye disease, etc.

original: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig can rnams kyis shes pa skra dang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig can rnams kyis shes pa skra dang sha sbrang dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, the consciousnesses of those whose eyes are impaired by eye disease appear as hairs, bees, flies, and so forth.

original: skra la sogs pa med par yang sgra la sogs pa mthong ngo snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de bzhin du gzhan du yang rnam par shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa med par yang sgra la sogs pa mthong ngo snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de bzhin du gzhan du yang rnam par shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though hairs and so forth do not exist, they think that they see sound and so forth. In the same way, consciousness itself appears in the aspect of blue and so forth.

original: don sngon po la sogs pa gud na gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: don sngon po la sogs pa gud na gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: There is no external object such as blue that exists separately. This is the conclusion.

original: rab rib dang ldan ba ni rab rib can no //
analyzed: rab rib dang ldan ba ni rab rib can no //
translated: One who has eye disease is one who has cataracts.

original: de ltar re zhig gzung ba bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzung ba bkag go //
translated: Thus, first the object is refuted.

original: gzung ba bkag na 'dzin pa yang bkag par de nyid kyis grub ste /
analyzed: gzung ba bkag na 'dzin pa yang bkag par de nyid kyis grub ste /
translated: When the object is refuted, the subject is also refuted by that very argument.

original: @175a * // 'di ltar gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang med do //
analyzed: @175a * // 'di ltar gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang med do //
translated: Thus, if the object does not exist, the subject also does not exist.

original: de ltar gzung ba bkag pa yang //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba bkag pa yang //
translated: Thus, the object is refuted.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas grags pa'i gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas grags pa'i gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it demonstrates the refutation of the assertions of the proponents of external objects.

original: 'dir 'di skad ces brgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad ces brgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, the following objection is stated:

original: gal te rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don las ma byung na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul nges pa mi 'grub /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don las ma byung na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul nges pa mi 'grub /
translated: If representations do not arise from external objects, then the determination of the object of representations is not established.

original: dus nges pa dang / sems nges pa med pa dang / bya ba med pa yang mi 'grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dus nges pa dang / sems nges pa med pa dang / bya ba med pa yang mi 'grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don bsdus pa'o //
translated: The determination of time, the determination of mind, and the absence of activity are also not established. This is the summarized meaning.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i phyogs 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i phyogs 'dir ro //
translated: Here means in this former position.

original: 'di skad bsgral zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i yul la sogs pa nges pa blo la rnam par bzhag nas 'di ltar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bsgral zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i yul la sogs pa nges pa blo la rnam par bzhag nas 'di ltar rtog pa'o //
translated: This objection is stated means that, having presented the determination of the object and so on to the mind, one should consider it as follows.

original: yul dang dus la nges med cing //
analyzed: yul dang dus la nges med cing //
translated: Without determination of object and time,

original: zhes bya ba la nges pa ni rnam par gnas pa'o //🔽yul la lar snang la thams cad na ma yin zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nges pa ni rnam par gnas pa'o // yul la lar snang la thams cad na ma yin zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa'o //
translated: Determination means abiding in a particular way.🔽Appearing in some objects but not in all is the determination of the object.

original: res 'ga' snang la thams cad du ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' snang la thams cad du ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus nges pa'o //
translated: Appearing sometimes but not always is the determination of time.

original: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad la bye brag med par snang gi gcig 'ga' la ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad la bye brag med par snang gi gcig 'ga' la ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems nges pa med pa'o //
translated: It appears to all who are in that place and time without distinction, not to some one person. This is the absence of determination of mind.

original: bya ba byed pa ni bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of action is the performance of action.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don cis gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don cis gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the treatise-maker clarifies the meaning of the sutra.

original: ji skad du bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If one asks, “How will it be taught?” and so on,

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
translated: If a consciousness appearing as form and so on arises without an object of form and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don dang 'brel ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'dir ci'i phyir 'di ltar yul la lar gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yul thams cad na ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don dang 'brel ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'dir ci'i phyir 'di ltar yul la lar gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yul thams cad na ma yin /
translated: and it is not related to an object of form and so on, then why does a consciousness appearing as an object of form and so on arise in some places and not in all places?

original: de bzhin du gang na phyi rol gyi don mthong ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba'i yul de nyid na res 'ga' 'byung gi dus thams cad du ma yin pa 'di la rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang na phyi rol gyi don mthong ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba'i yul de nyid na res 'ga' 'byung gi dus thams cad du ma yin pa 'di la rgyu ci yod /
translated: Likewise, when one sees external objects, the arising of manifest pride occurs in that very object, but not at all times. What is the cause of this?

original: de ni 'di skad du gang gi ltar na rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa de ltar na gang na gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don yod pa de nyid na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang gi ltar na rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa de ltar na gang na gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don yod pa de nyid na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa 'byung ste /
translated: This is what is being said: When consciousness is dependent on external objects, then at that time when external objects exist, consciousness arises.

original: yul dang dus nges par rigs so //🔽gang gi ltar na rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa ma yin pa de'i ltar na nges par byed pa don med pas yang na thams cad nas @175b thams cad du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yul dang dus nges par rigs so // gang gi ltar na rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa ma yin pa de'i ltar na nges par byed pa don med pas yang na thams cad nas @175b thams cad du 'byung ngo //
translated: It is reasonable that there is a restriction of time and place.

original: yang na gang du yang mi 'byung ste nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang du yang mi 'byung ste nam yang ma yin no //
translated: But when consciousness is not dependent on external objects, then since the restriction is pointless, either it arises everywhere and at all times, or it arises nowhere and at no time.

original: gang du yang la lar 'byung la la lar ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du res 'ga' ni 'byung la res 'ga' mi 'byung ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du yang la lar 'byung la la lar ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du res 'ga' ni 'byung la res 'ga' mi 'byung ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be the case that it would occur for some and not for others, and likewise that it would occur sometimes and not at other times.

original: de ltar re zhig yul dang dus nges pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yul dang dus nges pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: Thus it has been shown that determination of place and time is untenable.

original: sems nges pa med pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems nges pa med pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that determination of mind is untenable,

original: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “all the minds of living beings who are present in that place and time” and so on.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don yod par mi 'dod na de'i tshe ci'i phyir yul dang dus de na 'khod pa'i srog chags thams cad kyi sems rnams la rnam par rig pa nges pa med par 'gyur la 'ga' tsam la ma yin /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don yod par mi 'dod na de'i tshe ci'i phyir yul dang dus de na 'khod pa'i srog chags thams cad kyi sems rnams la rnam par rig pa nges pa med par 'gyur la 'ga' tsam la ma yin /
translated: If external objects do not exist, then why is it that the cognitions of all living beings who are present in that place and time are determined, and not just of some?

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example,

original: ji ltar rab rib can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Just as those who have eye disease” and so on.

original: dper na rab rib can la snang ba'i skra la sogs pa mthong bar ba rib can nyid kyi sems nyid la 'byung gi / rab rib med pa gzhan dag la ma yin pa de bzhin du ;
analyzed: dper na rab rib can la snang ba'i skra la sogs pa mthong bar ba rib can nyid kyi sems nyid la 'byung gi / rab rib med pa gzhan dag la ma yin pa de bzhin du ;
translated: For example, the hair and so on that appear to one with eye disease arise in the mind of one with eye disease, not in the mind of one without eye disease.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par rig pa 'byung na de'i tshe gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i don snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de 'byung ba de nyid la sngon po la sogs pa'i don mthong ngo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par rig pa 'byung na de'i tshe gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i don snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de 'byung ba de nyid la sngon po la sogs pa'i don mthong ngo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung
translated: If a cognition arises without an external object, then the self-notion that thinks “I see an object such as blue” arises in relation to the cognition that appears as an object such as blue.

original: gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise in relation to anything else.

original: de ni 'di skad du gzung ba'i cha la don du mthong ba'i nga rgyal 'byung ba gang yin pa ni gang la bzung ba'i cha yod pa de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gzung ba'i cha la don du mthong ba'i nga rgyal 'byung ba gang yin pa ni gang la bzung ba'i cha yod pa de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what it means: The self-notion that thinks “I see an object” arises in relation to the aspect of the object that is apprehended, not in relation to anything else.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi bzung ba'i cha ni gzhan gyis mi myong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi bzung ba'i cha ni gzhan gyis mi myong ngo //
translated: This is because the aspect of the object that is apprehended by one person is not experienced by another person.

original: bya ba byed pa yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the performance of action is untenable,

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “Why?” and so on.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa don la rag las pa ma yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra dang sbrang bu dang sha sbrang la sogs pas bcing ba dang za ba dang skyug pa'i bya ba mi byed la /🔽de ma yin pa'i mig ma nyams pas dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa don la rag las pa ma yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra dang sbrang bu dang sha sbrang la sogs pas bcing ba dang za ba dang skyug pa'i bya ba mi byed la / de ma yin pa'i mig ma nyams pas dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa /
translated: If consciousness does not depend on objects, then why do those with eye disease not perform the actions of binding, eating, and vomiting that are seen in the hair, flies, bees, and so on?🔽Why do others with unimpaired vision

original: gzhan dag gis ni ji skad du bstan pa de thams cad byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ji skad du bstan pa de thams cad byed /
translated: perform all the actions that are taught with regard to the hair and so on that are seen?

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gang dag rmi lam na mthong ba'i bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag gi zas skom la sogs pa'i bya ba 'grangs pa dang ngoms pa la sogs pa mi byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gang dag rmi lam na mthong ba'i bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag gi zas skom la sogs pa'i bya ba 'grangs pa dang ngoms pa la sogs pa mi byed la /
translated: Similarly, why do those who see food, drink, and so on in dreams not perform the actions of eating, drinking, and so on, which satisfy hunger and thirst?

original: de ma yin pa gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na mthong ba gzhan dag gis ni byed /🔽'di @176a * //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na mthong ba gzhan dag gis ni byed /🔽'di @176a * //
translated: Why do others who see these things when they are not asleep perform these actions?

original: la yang ci'i phyir dri za'i grong khyer med pas grong khyer gyi bya ba kun du srung ba la sogs pa mi byed la de ma yin pa rgyal po dang blon po dang bram ze dang grong gi skye bo gnas pa gzhan dag gis ni byed /
analyzed: la yang ci'i phyir dri za'i grong khyer med pas grong khyer gyi bya ba kun du srung ba la sogs pa mi byed la de ma yin pa rgyal po dang blon po dang bram ze dang grong gi skye bo gnas pa gzhan dag gis ni byed /
translated: Why do the gandharvas not perform all the actions of a city, such as protecting the city, because the city of the gandharvas does not exist? But other kings, ministers, brahmins, and townspeople who are not gandharvas do perform such actions.

original: thams cad med du 'dra na de'i phyir yang thams cad skral  sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad med du 'dra na de'i phyir yang thams cad skral  sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa'am /
translated: If they are all the same in being nonexistent, then either everything would perform the function of creating and so on,

original: yang na gang yang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gang yang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: or else nothing would perform such a function.

original: de ni 'di skad du gal te skra la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba bzung ba'i cha tsam dang 'brel pa yin na de'i tshe thams cad la bzung ba'i cha yod du mtshungs pas thams cad kyang don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te skra la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba bzung ba'i cha tsam dang 'brel pa yin na de'i tshe thams cad la bzung ba'i cha yod du mtshungs pas thams cad kyang don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: This is what is being said: If the mere part that is the object of apprehension is related to the hair and so on, then since the part that is the object of apprehension is the same in all, everything would perform the function of creating and so on.

original: / gang gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don yod pa de'i ltar na skra la sogs pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang / grong khyer la sogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: / gang gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don yod pa de'i ltar na skra la sogs pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang / grong khyer la sogs pa yang yod de /
translated: But according to those who maintain that external objects exist, hairs and so on, food and drink and so on, and cities and so on do exist.

original: de dag rang rang dang mthun pa'i don gyi bya ba yang byed do //
analyzed: de dag rang rang dang mthun pa'i don gyi bya ba yang byed do //
translated: And they perform the functions that are appropriate to them.

original: gang dag phyi rol na med pa rab rib can gyi skra la sogs pa dang ; rmi lam gyi zas skom la sogs pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa de dag ni don gyi bya ba gang yang mi byed do zhes bya ba de 'thad do //
analyzed: gang dag phyi rol na med pa rab rib can gyi skra la sogs pa dang ; rmi lam gyi zas skom la sogs pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa de dag ni don gyi bya ba gang yang mi byed do zhes bya ba de 'thad do //
translated: But those things that do not exist externally, such as the hairs and so on seen by one with an eye disease, food and drink and so on in a dream, and the cities of gandharvas and so on, do not perform any function.

original: dpe gsum po 'di dag ni 'khrul ba rnam pa gsum du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe gsum po 'di dag ni 'khrul ba rnam pa gsum du bstan pa yin te /
translated: These three examples illustrate three kinds of error.

original: dang po ni rab rib kyi 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rab rib kyi 'khrul ba'o //
translated: The first is the error of eye disease.

original: gnyis pa ni gnyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnyid do //
translated: The second is sleep.

original: gsum pa ni thag ring ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni thag ring ba'o //
translated: The third is distance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yul la sogs pa nges pa med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yul la sogs pa nges pa med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated that objects and so on are indeterminate, in order to summarize his point,🔽he says,

original: 'di dag don med par med du 'dra na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag don med par med du 'dra na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, If these are alike in being nonexistent, and so on.

original: de skad bstan pa'i rnam pa'i phyi rol gyi don med na yul la sogs pa bzhi mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de skad bstan pa'i rnam pa'i phyi rol gyi don med na yul la sogs pa bzhi mi rung ngo //
translated: If external objects do not exist in the way they are taught, the four, such as the object, are not tenable.

original: de bas na gdon mi za bar phyi rol gyi don khas blang bar bya'o zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: de bas na gdon mi za bar phyi rol gyi don khas blang bar bya'o zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept external objects. This is the opponent's position.

original: 'di la slob dpon lan gdab par ci la ma rag par chags nas /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon lan gdab par ci la ma rag par chags nas /
translated: Here, the master [Candrakīrti] thinks, Why not respond?

original: mi rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is not untenable, and so on.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa 'di bzhi ni phyi rol gyi don med par mi rung ba ma yin te rung ba nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa 'di bzhi ni phyi rol gyi don med par mi rung ba ma yin te rung ba nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The four aspects of ascertainment of the object and so on are not untenable in the absence of external objects, they are tenable, he thinks.

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis ni 'dir skabs yin par ston to //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis ni 'dir skabs yin par ston to //
translated: The two negations indicate that this is the context.

original: ji ltar rung zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rung zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How are they tenable? Therefore, he says:

original: 'di ltar / yul la sogs pa nges 'grub ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yul la sogs pa nges 'grub ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the object and so on is established.

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus nges te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus nges te /
translated: Thus, the object and time are ascertained.

original: rmi lam dang 'dra @176b bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra @176b bar 'grub bo //
translated: It is established as being like a dream.

original: 'dra zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dra zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of “like,”

original: rmi lam du rmis ba dang mtshungs pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam du rmis ba dang mtshungs pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “because it is similar to what is seen in a dream,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam du rmis pa dang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam du rmis pa dang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what is taught as being “similar to what is seen in a dream” is taught as being “like a dream.”

original: dpe'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dpe'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the example,

original: / ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: / ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “How is that?” and so on.

original: gal te don med par rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul dang dus nges par mi 'grub na /
analyzed: gal te don med par rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul dang dus nges par mi 'grub na /
translated: If it is not established that the objects and times of consciousnesses are ascertained without an object,

original: rmi lam na yang phyi rol gyi don med par yul la lan grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa snang la thams cad na ni ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang phyi rol gyi don med par yul la lan grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa snang la thams cad na ni ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how is it that in a dream, without an external object, objects such as a village or a pleasure grove appear in a certain place but not everywhere?

original: de bzhin du yul de nyid na yang grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa de res 'ga' snang la dus thams cad du ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul de nyid na yang grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa de res 'ga' snang la dus thams cad du ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, in that very place, how could a village, a pleasure grove, and so on sometimes appear and not always appear?

original: don med par yang yul la sogs pa nges par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don med par yang yul la sogs pa nges par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the determination of place and time is established even without external objects, he says,

original: don med bar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don med bar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Even without objects, etc.”

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don med par yang yul dang dus nges par 'grub bo //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don med par yang yul dang dus nges par 'grub bo //
translated: By the method taught above, the determination of place and time is established even without external objects.

original: sems nges pa med par grub pa dang dpe gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems nges pa med par grub pa dang dpe gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the establishment of the non-determination of mind and to teach by another example, he says,

original: sems kyang nges pa med ces bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
analyzed: sems kyang nges pa med ces bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
translated: “The mind also is not determined,” etc.

original: dper na don med par yi dgas rnams sems nges pa med par grub ba de bzhin du gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na don med par yi dgas rnams sems nges pa med par grub ba de bzhin du gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: Just as the non-existence of objects is established by the non-determination of the minds of hungry ghosts, so it is in other cases as well. This is the meaning of the summary statement.

original: mdo las ma smos te bya ba'i tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo las ma smos te bya ba'i tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not mentioned in the sutra, he draws it out from within the statement of the action.

original: grub ces bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub ces bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word established is to be supplied.

original: mdor zhes bya ba snga ma las grub ba smos pa'i rjes su bsnyag go zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor zhes bya ba snga ma las grub ba smos pa'i rjes su bsnyag go zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word in brief is to be supplied after established in the preceding verse. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir yang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to show the meaning of the word like,

original: yi dags rnams kyi dang mtshungs bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi dang mtshungs bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, like the hungry ghosts, etc.

original: 'dir ni kye zhes bya ba la bzhin zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni kye zhes bya ba la bzhin zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the word like is to be supplied to the word alas.

original: yi dags rnams kyi sems nges pa med pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi sems nges pa med pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the minds of hungry ghosts are not fixed,

original: ji ltar grub ces dris pa dang / bstan bcos byed pas grub ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar grub ces dris pa dang / bstan bcos byed pas grub ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he asks, How is this established? and in order to show the means of establishing this, the author of the treatise says, All of them, etc.

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus de na 'khod pa'i yi dags thams cad kyis klung la rnag la sogs par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus de na 'khod pa'i yi dags thams cad kyis klung la rnag la sogs par mthong ste /
translated: Thus, all the hungry ghosts who are present in that place and time see the river as pus, etc.

original: de bas na don med par yang sems nges pa med par grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na don med par yang sems nges pa med par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, even without an object, the mind is established as not fixed.

original: tshig gi don khong du chud @177a * //
analyzed: tshig gi don khong du chud @177a * //
translated: Understand the meaning of the words.🔽

original: pa ni ngag gi don khong du chud pa'i sngon du 'gro bas tshig gi don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa ni ngag gi don khong du chud pa'i sngon du 'gro bas tshig gi don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the words is comprehended by the comprehension of the meaning of the statement.

original: rnag gis gang ba'i klung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnag gis gang ba'i klung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to explain the meaning of the words, he says, “a river full of pus,” etc.

original: rnag gi klung zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: rnag gi klung zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: In this expression, “a river full of pus,”

original: gang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos so zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos so zhes ston to //
translated: the word “full” is not mentioned.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says,

original: mar gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mar gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “like a pot full of ghee.”

original: dper na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa la mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa la mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pot full of ghee is called a “pot of ghee.”

original: 'di la yang rnag gis gang ba'i klung la rnag gi klung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang rnag gis gang ba'i klung la rnag gi klung zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, a river full of pus is called a “river of pus.”

original: rnag med pa la thams cad kyis rnag tu ji ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: rnag med pa la thams cad kyis rnag tu ji ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How is it that everyone sees pus in a place where there is no pus?

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mtshungs pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mtshungs pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain this, he says, “those who are situated in a similar ripening of karma,” etc.

original: 'di ltar rnam par smin ba mtshungs pa la gnas pa'i yi dags ji snyed pa de dag kun gyis kyang 'dra bar klung rnag gis gang bar mthong ste gcig 'gas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin ba mtshungs pa la gnas pa'i yi dags ji snyed pa de dag kun gyis kyang 'dra bar klung rnag gis gang bar mthong ste gcig 'gas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, all the hungry ghosts who are in the same situation of having the same karmic maturation see the river as filled with pus; it is not just one of them.

original: de la rnag thigs ba 'ga' yang med na rnag gis gang ba'i klung lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: de la rnag thigs ba 'ga' yang med na rnag gis gang ba'i klung lta ga la yod de /
translated: If there is not even a drop of pus there, how could there be a river filled with pus?

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis na de dag gis de mthong ngo //🔽sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis na de dag gis de mthong ngo // sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Due to the power of the maturation of karma, they see it.

original: rnag gis gang ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnag gis gang ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of the term “etc.” is indicated by the phrase “just as it is filled with pus.”

original: dper na kha cig gis rnag gis gang bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na kha cig gis rnag gis gang bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as some see it as filled with pus,

original: kha cig gis gcin gyis gang ba dang / kha cig gis ngan skyugs kyis gang ba dang / kha cig gis dbyig pa thogs pa'i mi dag gis bsrungs pa dang / kha cig gis klung la ral gri thogs ba dag gis bsrungs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: kha cig gis gcin gyis gang ba dang / kha cig gis ngan skyugs kyis gang ba dang / kha cig gis dbyig pa thogs pa'i mi dag gis bsrungs pa dang / kha cig gis klung la ral gri thogs ba dag gis bsrungs par mthong ngo //
translated: Some see it as filled with urine, some as filled with vomit, some as guarded by men holding clubs, and some as guarded by men holding swords on the banks.

original: yi dags rnams kyis las kyi dbang gis dbyig pa dang ral gri thogs pa'i mi 'byung bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyis las kyi dbang gis dbyig pa dang ral gri thogs pa'i mi 'byung bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the hungry ghosts, by the power of karma, should produce men holding clubs and swords.

original: gzhan gyi las kyis gzhan dag byung bar gyur ta re /
analyzed: gzhan gyi las kyis gzhan dag byung bar gyur ta re /
translated: It is possible that others are produced by the karma of others.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sems nges pa med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sems nges pa med par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the uncertainty of mind in this way, in order to summarize, he says:

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de skad du bstan pa'i rnam pas don med par yang rnam par rig pa rnams kyis sems nges pa med par grub bo //
analyzed: de skad du bstan pa'i rnam pas don med par yang rnam par rig pa rnams kyis sems nges pa med par grub bo //
translated: In this way, by the method of teaching, it is established that the mind is uncertain, even in the absence of an object.

original: don med pa la bya ba byed ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don med pa la bya ba byed ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that an objectless activity is possible, he says:

original: bya byed rmi lam gnod ba 'dra //
analyzed: bya byed rmi lam gnod ba 'dra //
translated: Activity is like a dream, like a wound.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says this.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi gnod pa don med par yang grub ba de bzhin du don byed pa de gzhan yang don med par grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi gnod pa don med par yang grub ba de bzhin du don byed pa de gzhan yang don med par grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: Just as the harm in a dream is established as pointless, so also the function is established as pointless. This is the meaning of the summary.

original: bya ba'i @177b tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i @177b tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to bring out the verbal root of the word “established,”

original: grub ces bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub ces bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “one should understand the word ‘established.’ ”

original: mdor byas pa gong ma las grub ces bya ba'i sgra la snyegs pa 'dir yang sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdor byas pa gong ma las grub ces bya ba'i sgra la snyegs pa 'dir yang sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “established” in the previous summary is to be applied here also. This is the meaning of the word “also.”

original: dpe rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the example,

original: dper na rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “For example, in a dream,” and so on.

original: dper na rmi lam na skyes pa dang bud med gnyis ma phrad par khu ba byung ba de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnod pa 'byung ba de bzhin du skra dang sha sbrang dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang / grong khyer dang grong rdal dang dug dang mtshon dang lce 'bab pas bsgrib par bya ba'i don skra la sogs pa med par yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na skyes pa dang bud med gnyis ma phrad par khu ba byung ba de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnod pa 'byung ba de bzhin du skra dang sha sbrang dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang / grong khyer dang grong rdal dang dug dang mtshon dang lce 'bab pas bsgrib par bya ba'i don skra la sogs pa med par yang 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, just as semen is emitted without the union of a man and a woman in a dream, so too, the harm of a dream occurs. Just as in a dream, hair, flies, food, drink, cities, towns, poison, weapons, and lightning obscurations occur without the objects of hair, etc.

original: gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And without the union of the two, i.e., without the union of a man and a woman.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gong du smos pa'i brgal ba rnam pa bzhi char gyi lan btab nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gong du smos pa'i brgal ba rnam pa bzhi char gyi lan btab nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, having responded to the four types of objections mentioned above, in order to summarize, he says,

original: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, first of all, etc.

original: de skad bstan pa'i rnam pas re zhig dpe gzhan dang gzhan dag gis yul dang dus nges pa la sogs pa bzhi grub bo //
analyzed: de skad bstan pa'i rnam pas re zhig dpe gzhan dang gzhan dag gis yul dang dus nges pa la sogs pa bzhi grub bo //
translated: In this way, by means of the teaching of these examples, the four, such as the determination of place and time, are established for the time being.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni yang 'grub bo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni yang 'grub bo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba bstan to //
translated: The word “for the time being” indicates that the word “established” is to be supplied below.

original: yang dpe gcig gis brgal ba bzhi char gyi lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dpe gcig gis brgal ba bzhi char gyi lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to answer all four objections with a single example,

original: thams cad sems can dmyal ba bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: thams cad sems can dmyal ba bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “All is like the hells.”

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba dag na don med par yang yul nges pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa de bzhin du gzhan du yang don med par rnam pa bzhi po yang thams cad grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba dag na don med par yang yul nges pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod pa de bzhin du gzhan du yang don med par rnam pa bzhi po yang thams cad grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: Just as in the hells, the four, such as the determination of place, exist without purpose, so too elsewhere, the four exist without purpose. All is established.

original: bya ba'i tshig kho nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i tshig kho nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the word “established” is supplied by the verbal expression,

original: grub ces bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub ces bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “One should understand that the word ‘established’ is supplied.”

original: don de brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood by the convention.

original: 'dra ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the example,🔽he says,

original: sems can dmyal ba dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the hells, etc.

original: don de brda phrad par zad do //🔽sems can dmyal ba dag na yul la sogs pa nges pa bzhi ma bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar grub ces dris ba dang / bstan bcos byed pas grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
