analyzed: don de brda phrad par zad do // sems can dmyal ba dag na yul la sogs pa nges pa bzhi ma bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar grub ces dris ba dang / bstan bcos byed pas grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is self-evident.

original: dmyal ba'i srung ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srung ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since the four certainties of object, etc. are not taught in the hells, it is asked, “How are they established?” And in order to demonstrate that they are established, the treatise states:🔽The hell guardians, etc.

original: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / rdza ma dang / zangs po che la sogs ba med par yang sems can dmyal ba rnams kyis @178a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / rdza ma dang / zangs po che la sogs ba med par yang sems can dmyal ba rnams kyis @178a * //
translated: Thus, even without hell guardians, pots, cauldrons, etc., the hell beings

original: yul dang dus nges par mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul dang dus nges par mthong ngo //
translated: see the certainties of object and time.

original: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad kyis bye brag med par mthong ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus de na 'khod pa thams cad kyis bye brag med par mthong ste /
translated: All who are present at that time and place see them without distinction.

original: med par yang de dag gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed do zhes mdor bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med par yang de dag gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed do zhes mdor bya ba'i don to //
translated: And even though they do not exist, they inflict various harms. This is the meaning in brief.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the summary in detail, the treatise states:

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For example, in the hells, etc.

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba dag na sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa yul nges pa dang dus nges par grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba dag na sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa yul nges pa dang dus nges par grub pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the hells, the hells-guardians, etc. are established with respect to the sentient beings in the hells, with respect to a definite place and a definite time.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /🔽khyi dang bya rog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir / khyi dang bya rog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the term “etc.,” he says:🔽dogs, crows, iron-beasts, etc.

original: khyi dang bya rog dang lcags kyi ril sogs pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyi dang bya rog dang lcags kyi ril sogs pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “dogs, crows, iron-beasts, etc.” is to be resolved into a genitive tatpurusa compound.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa smos pa ni rdza ma dang zangs po che la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa smos pa ni rdza ma dang zangs po che la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Here, the term “etc.” includes pots, cauldrons, etc.

original: sems nges pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems nges pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the indefiniteness of the mind, he says:

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: all of them, etc.

original: don de yang brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de yang brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning of this is self-evident.

original: bya ba byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the performance of action, he says:

original: de dag gis de dag la gnod pa yang grub ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gis de dag la gnod pa yang grub ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and they are also established as the harm-doers to them.

original: gnod pa'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs byed par grub bo //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs byed par grub bo //
translated: The various specific harms are established.

original: 'di la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, this is the transformation:

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa dag med na yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa bzhi po ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa dag med na yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa bzhi po ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: If the hell guardians and so on do not exist, how do the four types of determination regarding objects and so on occur?

original: med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: de dag med kyang rnam pa bzhi po de grub bo //
analyzed: de dag med kyang rnam pa bzhi po de grub bo //
translated: Even though they do not exist, those four types are established.

original: med pa de ji ltar grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: med pa de ji ltar grub snyam pa la /
translated: How are those non-existents established?🔽In response to this, it is said:

original: rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ripening of their own karma and so on.

original: gang de dag gis sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las sngon byas pa las /
analyzed: gang de dag gis sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las sngon byas pa las /
translated: From the karma previously created by them that will be experienced as suffering,

original: de'i rnam par smin pa gang gi tshe mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / khyi dang bya rog dang / lcags kyi ri dang / rdza ma dang zangs po che la sogs pa'i rnam bar shes pa nyid byung nas sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i sgyu thabs kyis sems can dmyal ba pa de dag sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyed de /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa gang gi tshe mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / khyi dang bya rog dang / lcags kyi ri dang / rdza ma dang zangs po che la sogs pa'i rnam bar shes pa nyid byung nas sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i sgyu thabs kyis sems can dmyal ba pa de dag sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyed de /
translated: When the maturation of that karma manifests, the consciousness of the hell guardians, dogs, crows, iron mountains, clay pots, cauldrons, and so on arises and the magical display of hell guardians and so on generates feelings of suffering in hell beings.🔽The consciousness of all those hell beings who have committed the karma to experience such suffering arises as the magical display of hell guardians and so on and generates feelings of suffering.

original: ji snyed kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de byas par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa nyid @178b sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa byung nas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed kyi gcig 'ga' la ni ma
analyzed: ji snyed kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de byas par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa nyid @178b sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa byung nas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed kyi gcig 'ga' la ni ma
translated: It is not that the consciousness of any one being arises as the magical display of hell guardians and so on and generates feelings of suffering.

original: yin no // de yang mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // de yang mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not impossible,

original: rmi lam gyi gnas na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in dreams.

original: dper na sdig ba can gyi rmi lam na las kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid seng ge dang stag dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i rnam par byung na sdug bsngal dang skrag pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa skyed pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal
analyzed: dper na sdig ba can gyi rmi lam na las kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa nyid seng ge dang stag dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i rnam par byung na sdug bsngal dang skrag pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa skyed pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal
translated: For example, in a sinful dream, consciousness itself arises in the aspect of lions, tigers, and robbers, etc. due to the power of karma, and it generates suffering, fear, and so on.

original: ba dag na yang de srid do //
analyzed: ba dag na yang de srid do //
translated: Likewise, in the hells, there are also such things.

original: de'i phyir da ltar dpe la yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa bzhi bstan nas dngos la bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar dpe la yul la sogs pa nges pa rnam pa bzhi bstan nas dngos la bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, having taught the four types of ascertainment of object, etc. in the example, in order to teach the actual case,

original: de bzhin du gzhan na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Likewise, in other cases, etc.”

original: de'i don yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i don yang bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of that has already been explained.

original: bye brag tu smra ba sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa sems can rnams su 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa sems can rnams su 'dod de /
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that the hell guardians, etc. are sentient beings.

original: 'dir de ltar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to debate that,

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Why?” and so on.

original: khyed ci'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / khyi dang bya rog de dag sems can rnams su mi 'dod /
analyzed: khyed ci'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang / khyi dang bya rog de dag sems can rnams su mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the hell guardians, dogs, and crows are sentient beings?

original: 'di ltar de dag la ni sems can gyi tshul yang snang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la ni sems can gyi tshul yang snang /
translated: Because the mode of being a sentient being appears in them.

original: sems can bzhin du g-yo ba yang yod /
analyzed: sems can bzhin du g-yo ba yang yod /
translated: They move like sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar de dag la blo'i bya ba spyod pa dang rjod pa yang snang ste de gnyis kyis gzhan la sems yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la blo'i bya ba spyod pa dang rjod pa yang snang ste de gnyis kyis gzhan la sems yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
translated: Because the activity of the mind, the performance of actions and speech, appears in them, it is possible to infer the existence of a mind in them on the basis of those two.

original: gal te de dag la sems yod par dpag pa de gnyis med na de'i tshe srog chags gzhan la sems yod par rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de dag la sems yod par dpag pa de gnyis med na de'i tshe srog chags gzhan la sems yod par rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the two bases for inferring the existence of a mind in them do not exist, then it would be impossible to infer the existence of a mind in other living beings.

original: de gnyis 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are erroneous.

original: srog chags su mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog chags su mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is illogical that they are living beings, he says,

original: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because it is illogical.

original: mi rigs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very illogicality, he says,

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: they are not living beings.

original: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams su mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams su mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, the guardians of the hells are not sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why are they not sentient beings?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “In the same way,” and so on.

original: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can gzhan dag sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal so sor myong ba de bzhin du de dag de ltar mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can gzhan dag sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal so sor myong ba de bzhin du de dag de ltar mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as other sentient beings in the hells experience the individual sufferings of the hells, they do not experience them in the same way.

original: gang gnod pa byed pa de gnod par byed pa bzhin du sdug bsngal mi myong ste /
analyzed: gang gnod pa byed pa de gnod par byed pa bzhin du sdug bsngal mi myong ste /
translated: Those who inflict harm do not experience suffering in the same way as those who are harmed.

original: @179a * // gang sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma de dag la gnod pa byed pa ni gang yang yod skad mi grag go //
analyzed: @179a * // gang sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma de dag la gnod pa byed pa ni gang yang yod skad mi grag go //
translated: It is not said that there are any who inflict harm on the guardians of the hells.

original: gang sems can bzhin du g-yo ba de yang rang dga' ste ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang sems can bzhin du g-yo ba de yang rang dga' ste ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who move like sentient beings do so not of their own accord,

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis so //
translated: but by the power of the karma of the sentient beings in the hells.

original: sems can gyi tshul ni gzugs kyi lus dang ri mo'i lus la yang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshul ni gzugs kyi lus dang ri mo'i lus la yang yod de /
translated: The nature of sentient beings exists in the bodies of sentient beings, and also in the bodies of pictures.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the case.

original: gcig la gcig gnod pa byed do snyam pa la /
analyzed: gcig la gcig gnod pa byed do snyam pa la /
translated: They harm each other.

original: gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽gal te sems can dmyal ba pa dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma dag gcig la gcig gnod pa byed na ni 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa dag go //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te sems can dmyal ba pa dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma dag gcig la gcig gnod pa byed na ni 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa dag go //
translated: The text says, “They harm each other,” and so on.

original: 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag go zhes ma 'dres par rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag go zhes ma 'dres par rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sentient beings in hell and the hell guardians harm each other, then there would be no unmixed establishment of the sentient beings in hell and the hell guardians.

original: 'di ltar gang dag gnod par bya ba de dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams su 'dod /🔽gang dag gnod par byed pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag tu 'dod na gnyis mtshungs par gnod par bya ba'am /🔽gnod pa byed pa de nyid yin na ni gang dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag gnod par bya ba de dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams su 'dod / gang dag gnod par byed pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag tu 'dod na gnyis mtshungs par gnod par bya ba'am / gnod pa byed pa de nyid yin na ni gang dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa /
translated: That is, those who are harmed are sentient beings in hell,🔽and those who harm are the hell guardians.

original: gang dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma zhes brjod par bya /
translated: If both are similar in being harmed or harming, then how can you say that some are sentient beings in hell and others are hell guardians?

original: 'dir gtan tshigs lhag par byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs mtshungs pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs lhag par byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs mtshungs pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, the reason is stated: “Those who are similar in form, size, and strength.”

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag kyang sems can dmyal ba par gyur pa na ni de'i tshe gnyi ga yang byad gzugs mtshungs pa dang / bong tshod mtshungs pa dang / stobs mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag kyang sems can dmyal ba par gyur pa na ni de'i tshe gnyi ga yang byad gzugs mtshungs pa dang / bong tshod mtshungs pa dang / stobs mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the guardians of the hells were to become hell-beings, then both would be similar in form, size, and strength.

original: de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang sems can dmyal ba pa byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs mtshungs pa dag ni gcig la gcig gnod pa byed kyang ji ltar grag pa rnam pa de lta bur 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dang sems can dmyal ba pa byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs mtshungs pa dag ni gcig la gcig gnod pa byed kyang ji ltar grag pa rnam pa de lta bur 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the guardians of the hells and the hell-beings were similar in form, size, and strength, then they would not be destroyed in the way that is commonly thought.

original: grag pa ni 'di skad du grag ste /
analyzed: grag pa ni 'di skad du grag ste /
translated: The common opinion is as follows:

original: sems can dmyal ba pa dag sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma ma rung ba'i tshul can lus bong che ba shin tu stobs dang ldan pa rnams mthong nas phyogs mtha' dag mun par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dag sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma ma rung ba'i tshul can lus bong che ba shin tu stobs dang ldan pa rnams mthong nas phyogs mtha' dag mun par gyur te /
translated: The hell beings, seeing the terrible forms of the hell guardians, huge bodies, and great strength, are overcome with fear.

original: de dag gi lus kyang bag 'khums mgo yang rmongs so //🔽byad gzugs ni rkang lag gnas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi lus kyang bag 'khums mgo yang rmongs so // byad gzugs ni rkang lag gnas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Their bodies are paralyzed and their heads are filled with confusion.

original: bong tshog  @179b ni zheng gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: bong tshog  @179b ni zheng gi khyad par ro //
translated: Their appearance is the difference in the location of their arms and legs.🔽Their size is the difference in their width.

original: stobs ni lus kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: stobs ni lus kyi mthu'o //
translated: Their strength is the power of their bodies.

original: 'dir yang rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another principle here,

original: lcags rab tu 'bar ba'i sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lcags rab tu 'bar ba'i sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says, “the ground of glowing iron,” and so on.

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag kyang sems can dmyal ba ba bzhin du sdug bsngal myong ba ni de'i tshe tsha ba'i sdug bsngal yang mi bzod na ji ltar de na sems can dmyal ba pa rnams la gnod pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma dag kyang sems can dmyal ba ba bzhin du sdug bsngal myong ba ni de'i tshe tsha ba'i sdug bsngal yang mi bzod na ji ltar de na sems can dmyal ba pa rnams la gnod pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: If the hell guardians experience suffering like the hell beings, and at that time cannot bear the suffering of heat, how could they harm the hell beings?

original: de dag rab tu 'bar ba'i sa gzhi de la 'gre ldog ste rang gi lus kyang 'dzin par mi nus na gzhan la gnod pa byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de dag rab tu 'bar ba'i sa gzhi de la 'gre ldog ste rang gi lus kyang 'dzin par mi nus na gzhan la gnod pa byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: They roll around on that blazing ground, unable to hold their own bodies, let alone harm others.

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba par ma gyur du zin kyang yi dags sam dud 'gro zhig ni yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba par ma gyur du zin kyang yi dags sam dud 'gro zhig ni yin no snyam pa la /
translated: If they are not hell beings, then they must be hungry ghosts or animals.

original: de'i phyir / sems can dmyal ba pa ma yin pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems can dmyal ba pa ma yin pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To respond to this, the root text says, “Those who are not hell beings . . .

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma dag kyang khyi dang bya rog rnams sems can dmyal ba par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma dag kyang khyi dang bya rog rnams sems can dmyal ba par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that the guardians of the hells, such as the dogs and crows, are hell beings,

original: de'i tshe dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi bye brag yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus pa de dag sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro bar 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi bye brag yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus pa de dag sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro bar 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: then how could those who are included in the destinies of animals and hungry ghosts be born in the destiny of the hells?

original: bye brag tu smra bas de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: To respond to this, the Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: 'o na dud 'gro dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'o na dud 'gro dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Well then, animals . . .

original: gal te 'gro ba gzhan gyis bsdus pa dag 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'byung na mtho ris su glang po ches srung gi bu dang / ngang mo dang khrung khrung dang ne tsho dang ri skegs la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba gzhan gyis bsdus pa dag 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'byung na mtho ris su glang po ches srung gi bu dang / ngang mo dang khrung khrung dang ne tsho dang ri skegs la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung ste /
translated: If those included in other reincarnating beings do not occur in other reincarnating beings, how do the elephant, the female swan, the crane, the sparrow, the myna bird, and so on occur in the higher existences?

original: der ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du sems can dmyal bar yang dud 'gro'i bye brag khyi dang bya rog la sogs pa dang / yi dags kyi bye brag dmyal ba'i srung ma 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: der ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du sems can dmyal bar yang dud 'gro'i bye brag khyi dang bya rog la sogs pa dang / yi dags kyi bye brag dmyal ba'i srung ma 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Just as they occur there, so also in the hells, the various animals such as dogs, crows, and so on, and the various hungry ghosts such as the hell guardians occur.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar dud 'gro mtho ris su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir / ji ltar dud 'gro mtho ris su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To dispel that doubt, he says:🔽Just as animals occur in the higher existences,

original: ji ltar dud 'gro mtho ris su byung ba de ltar sems can dmyal ba par 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar dud 'gro mtho ris su byung ba de ltar sems can dmyal ba par 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: so it is not logical that they occur in the hells.

original: yi dags rnams kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyang ma yin te /
translated: Hungry ghosts also do not occur there.

original: 'di ltar dud 'gro dang yi dags de dag gis sems can dmyal ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal mi myong ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar dud 'gro dang yi dags de dag gis sems can dmyal ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal mi myong ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the Abhidharma treatise is that animals and ghosts do not experience the suffering of the hells.

original: bstan bcos byed pas dpe dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i thabs kyis mdor byas pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dud 'gro gang dag ces bya ba la sogs @180a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas dpe dang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i thabs kyis mdor byas pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir / dud 'gro gang dag ces bya ba la sogs @180a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the Abhidharma treatise by means of a method that is not similar to the example,

original: ba smos so //
analyzed: ba smos so //
translated: he says, “Those animals that are born in the heavens,” and so on.

original: de ni dud 'gro mtho ris su skye ba dag dang mi mtshungs te /🔽'di ltar dud 'gro gang dag mtho ris su 'byung ba de dag ni mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba gang dag yod pa de las gang gis grub pa des mtho ris der 'byung ba dag mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa'i
analyzed: de ni dud 'gro mtho ris su skye ba dag dang mi mtshungs te / 'di ltar dud 'gro gang dag mtho ris su 'byung ba de dag ni mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba gang dag yod pa de las gang gis grub pa des mtho ris der 'byung ba dag mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa'i
translated: That is not similar to the birth of animals in the heavens.🔽Thus, those animals that are born in the heavens experience the pleasures that exist in the world of the vessel of the heavens, by means of whatever is established in the heavens.

original: bde ba so sor myong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba so sor myong ngo //
translated: Those born in the heavens experience the pleasures that exist in the world of the vessel of the heavens.

original: gal te dud 'gro de dag ji ltar lha'i bde ba myong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dud 'gro de dag ji ltar lha'i bde ba myong zhe na /
translated: If those animals experience the pleasures of the gods, how is that?

original: smras pa / ngang tshul ngan pas ni de dag dud 'gro'i 'gro ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: smras pa / ngang tshul ngan pas ni de dag dud 'gro'i 'gro ba 'thob bo //
translated: He replied: Those who are of bad character obtain the animal life-form.

original: sbyin pas ni lha'i longs spyod 'thob ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni lha'i longs spyod 'thob ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: But those who are of good character obtain the divine life-form through giving.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las 'gro ba gzhan la yang de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'gro ba gzhan du rnam par smin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las 'gro ba gzhan la yang de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis 'gro ba gzhan du rnam par smin te /
translated: Thus, a karma that is to be experienced in the desire realm may ripen in another life-form due to the power of other conditions.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du bde ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du bde ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in the world of the environment” should be connected with the phrase “to experience pleasure.”

original: las gang gis snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba grub pa de snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las gang gis snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba grub pa de snod kyi 'jig rten na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That karma by which the world of the environment is established is called “to experience pleasure in the world of the environment.”

original: de na yod pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de na yod pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “the pleasure that exists there”

original: de zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang sbyar te /
translated: refers to the world of the environment of the higher realms.

original: de'i phyir mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtho ris kyi snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “the pleasure that exists there” means “the pleasure that exists in the world of the environment of the higher realms.”

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the point.

original: sems can dmyal bar yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam pa la de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam pa la de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Since it is thought that it would be the same for hell beings, therefore, the text says, “The guardians of the hells, etc.,” and so on.

original: ji ltar glang po ches srung gi bu la sogs pa mtho ris na bde ba myong ba de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma la sogs pas sems can dmyal ba'i snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa'i sdug bsngal mi myong ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar glang po ches srung gi bu la sogs pa mtho ris na bde ba myong ba de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba pa'i srung ma la sogs pas sems can dmyal ba'i snod kyi 'jig rten na yod pa'i sdug bsngal mi myong ngo //
translated: Just as the son of the elephant keeper, etc., experience pleasure in the higher realms, so the guardians of the hells, etc., do not experience the suffering that exists in the world of the hells.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dpe dang mi 'dra bar bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dpe dang mi 'dra bar bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, having shown that the example is not similar, in order to summarize, the text says:

original: de'i phyir dud 'gro dag der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dud 'gro dag der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, animals do not exist there.

original: gang gi phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal mi myong ba de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba der dud 'gro 'byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal mi myong ba de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba der dud 'gro 'byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: Because the guardians of the hells, etc., do not experience the suffering of the hells, therefore it is not logical that animals exist in the hells.

original: yi dags rnams kyang ma yin na zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyang ma yin na zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: and they are not hungry ghosts.

original: de ltar bye brag tu smra ba lan med par byas pa dang mdo sde bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag tu smra ba lan med par byas pa dang mdo sde bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus the Vaibhāṣika position is refuted.

original: sems can dmyal ba de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @180b so ;
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @180b so ;
translated: The Sautrāntika response to that is stated in the line “Those hell guardians are not sentient beings.”

original: / gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa de dag sems can gyi grangs su mi rung na yang /
analyzed: / gal te sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa de dag sems can gyi grangs su mi rung na yang /
translated: Even though those hell guardians and so on are not suitable to be counted as sentient beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba de dag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis sems can dmyal ba der sa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i bye brag dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba de dag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis sems can dmyal ba der sa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i bye brag dag 'byung ste /
translated: due to the power of the karma of those hell beings, various things such as earth and so on appear there in that hell.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa dag pas mdog gnag pa dang / ser ba la sogs pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba'i byad gzugs dang / lus kyi khru la sogs pa'i bong tshod dang / sems can dmyal ba zil gyis gnon pa'i stobs kyi bye brag gang gis sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i ming thob bo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dag pas mdog gnag pa dang / ser ba la sogs pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba'i byad gzugs dang / lus kyi khru la sogs pa'i bong tshod dang / sems can dmyal ba zil gyis gnon pa'i stobs kyi bye brag gang gis sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i ming thob bo //
translated: The color of the hell beings is darker, yellow, and so on, and their bodies are huge, with terrifying faces, hands, feet, and so on, and they have the power to overpower the hell beings.

original: gal te sems med na ji ltar sems can bzhin du g-yo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems med na ji ltar sems can bzhin du g-yo zhe na /
translated: If they are mindless, how can they move like sentient beings?

original: de'i phyir gang lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they extend their hands and so on.

original: sems med du zin kyang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang gis de dag gang gi phyir mtshon cha 'debs par gzas pa dang / so gtsigs pa dang / mig bgrad pa dang / smin ma khro gnyer du bsdus pa dang / gtum pa'i bya ba sna tshogs byed par snang ba de lta de lta bur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med du zin kyang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang gis de dag gang gi phyir mtshon cha 'debs par gzas pa dang / so gtsigs pa dang / mig bgrad pa dang / smin ma khro gnyer du bsdus pa dang / gtum pa'i bya ba sna tshogs byed par snang ba de lta de lta bur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are mindless, due to the power of the sentient beings in the hells, they appear to those sentient beings as if they were weapons, as if they were teeth, as if they were eyes, as if they were eyebrows knitted in anger, as if they were various kinds of fierce actions.

original: ci'i phyir de dag snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag snang zhe na /
translated: Why do they appear?

original: 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //🔽sems can dmyal ba pa rnams 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir de dag de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so // sems can dmyal ba pa rnams 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir de dag de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: It is said: “in order to generate fear.”🔽They appear in that way in order to generate the suffering of fear in the hell beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa dag gis 'jigs pa sdug bsngal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang sngon byas pa nyid kyi rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dag gis 'jigs pa sdug bsngal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang sngon byas pa nyid kyi rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: They are the karmic maturation of the very actions previously performed by the hell beings that will be experienced as the suffering of fear.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams de ltar gyur nas sems can dmyal ba pa dag la de ltar 'jigs par byed pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i dpe 'dir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams de ltar gyur nas sems can dmyal ba pa dag la de ltar 'jigs par byed pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i dpe 'dir /
translated: are the cause of fear and harm for the hell beings,

original: dper na lug lta bu'i ri dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na lug lta bu'i ri dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: in the same way, the mountains in the form of sheep, etc.,🔽are the cause of fear and harm for the hell beings.

original: dper na sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs kyang las kyi dbang gis lug lta bu'i ri dag 'ong ba dang 'gro bas sems can dmyal ba pa dag la 'jigs par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs kyang las kyi dbang gis lug lta bu'i ri dag 'ong ba dang 'gro bas sems can dmyal ba pa dag la 'jigs par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though the mountains in the form of sheep, etc., are not included in the number of sentient beings, they come and go by the power of karma and are the cause of fear and harm for the hell beings.

original: yang dper na lcags kyi shal ma li'i nags tshal la sems can dmyal ba dag yar 'dzegs pa'i tshe ni tsher ma kha thur du lta /
analyzed: yang dper na lcags kyi shal ma li'i nags tshal la sems can dmyal ba dag yar 'dzegs pa'i tshe ni tsher ma kha thur du lta /
translated: Again, for example, in the forest of razor-sharp sword leaves, when the hell beings climb up the trees, the leaves face downward.

original: slar 'bab pa'i tshe ni gyen du lta ste /🔽de la gnod par byed kyang de dag la sems @181a * //
analyzed: slar 'bab pa'i tshe ni gyen du lta ste / de la gnod par byed kyang de dag la sems @181a * //
translated: When they climb down, the leaves face upward.

original: yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Even though they do not have a mind,

original: sems yod pa lta bur bya ba byed pa dag snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems yod pa lta bur bya ba byed pa dag snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: they appear to have a mind and perform a function.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the case.

original: lug lta bu'i ri la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: lug lta bu'i ri la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: It is not the case that there are mountains that are like sheep, etc.🔽To this, the author of the treatise says,

original: de dag ni med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are not nonexistent.

original: gang lug lta bu'i ri la sogs pa de dag ni med pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang lug lta bu'i ri la sogs pa de dag ni med pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that those mountains that are like sheep, etc. are not nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni mig la sogs pa mnyam pa'i gzung ba'o zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni mig la sogs pa mnyam pa'i gzung ba'o zhes phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Thus, they are objects of the eye, etc.

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'dir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'dir /
translated: The author of the treatise says here:

original: gal te de'i las kyis der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te de'i las kyis der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you maintain that they are the product of karma,

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i sems can de dag gi las kyi dbang gis sems can dmyal ba der 'byung ba dag mdog dang byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs dang ldan pa de lta bu dag 'byung bar 'dod na lag pa 'degs pa la sogs pa'i bya
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba'i sems can de dag gi las kyi dbang gis sems can dmyal ba der 'byung ba dag mdog dang byad gzugs dang bong tshod dang stobs dang ldan pa de lta bu dag 'byung bar 'dod na lag pa 'degs pa la sogs pa'i bya
translated: If you maintain that those sentient beings in hell who are born in hell through the power of their karma are born there with such a color, shape, size, and strength, and you also maintain that they are agents who perform the actions of raising their arms, etc.,

original: ba byed pa por 'gyur ba dag tu yang 'dod na /
analyzed: ba byed pa por 'gyur ba dag tu yang 'dod na /
translated: then you should not say that they are the product of karma.

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa nyid sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag dang / lag pa la sogs pa 'degs pa'i bya ba byed par 'byung ba dang 'gyur bar cis mi 'dod ces mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa nyid sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag dang / lag pa la sogs pa 'degs pa'i bya ba byed par 'byung ba dang 'gyur bar cis mi 'dod ces mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary statement.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pas khong du chud par dka' bas de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pas khong du chud par dka' bas de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
translated: Since consciousness is transformed, it is difficult to understand, and so in order to liberate it,

original: de'i las rnams kyis rnam par shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i las rnams kyis rnam par shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “The actions of those who have that consciousness,” etc.

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba dang 'gyur bar yang 'dod na /
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba dang 'gyur bar yang 'dod na /
translated: For example, you accept that the elements arise and transform through the power of the karma of beings in hell.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod la /
translated: Why not accept that consciousness itself arises and transforms as the hell guardians, etc.?🔽Why do you imagine that the elements exist?

original: khyod ci'i phyir 'byung ba rnams su rtog / de dag la ni mthu lhag ma ci yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: khyod ci'i phyir 'byung ba rnams su rtog / de dag la ni mthu lhag ma ci yang mi snang ngo //
translated: No other power is seen in them.

original: 'di ltar de dag yod pa tsam gyis 'jigs pa la sogs pa mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag yod pa tsam gyis 'jigs pa la sogs pa mi skyed kyi /
translated: For, if they merely exist, fear, etc., is not produced.

original: dmigs nas 'jigs bskyed kyi /
analyzed: dmigs nas 'jigs bskyed kyi /
translated: and having observed, it generates fear.

original: dmigs pa ni de dag gi de'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni de dag gi de'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The observed object is the arising of consciousness of those.

original: de bas na gnyi ga la grub pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar brtag pa ni rigs kyi 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga la grub pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar brtag pa ni rigs kyi 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to consider that consciousness is transformed in both, not the elements.

original: gnyi ga lam grub pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas na yang rnam par shes pa nyid tshig dang lus dang g-yo ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par gyur par grags kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga lam grub pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas na yang rnam par shes pa nyid tshig dang lus dang g-yo ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par gyur par grags kyi /
translated: Because of being established in both, consciousness itself is known to be transformed in various ways, such as speech, body, and movement, even in dream states and so on.

original: 'byung ba rnams ni gang du yang ma grags te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni gang du yang ma grags te /
translated: The elements are not known anywhere.

original: las rnams kyi rnam par shes pa @181b nyid gyur par rigs so //
analyzed: las rnams kyi rnam par shes pa @181b nyid gyur par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that consciousness itself is transformed in karmic actions.

original: 'dir yang gtan tshigs lhag par yang //
analyzed: 'dir yang gtan tshigs lhag par yang //
translated: Here, the reason is further stated:

original: gzhan na las kyi bag chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan na las kyi bag chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In another, in the latent tendencies of karma, and so on.

original: las kyis skyed pa'i bag chags ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan la gnas la de'i 'bras bu ni gzhan du phyi rol gyi 'byung ba gyur par rtog na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gang la bag chags de gnas pa de nyid la de'i 'bras bu mi 'dod
analyzed: las kyis skyed pa'i bag chags ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan la gnas la de'i 'bras bu ni gzhan du phyi rol gyi 'byung ba gyur par rtog na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gang la bag chags de gnas pa de nyid la de'i 'bras bu mi 'dod
translated: then you must explain here the reason why the result of that does not exist in the continuum of consciousness in which the latent potentialities exist.

original: pa'i rgyu 'dir brjod dgos so zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu 'dir brjod dgos so zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach extensively the meaning of the summary, the author of the treatise says,

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi las gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi las gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “What karma of sentient beings in hell…” and so on.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams kyi las gang gis mdog dang byad gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par 'byung ba rnams las byung ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa 'degs pa bya ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang rtog pa'i las de'i bag chags gang yin pa de sems can de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de la gnas kyi 'byung ba la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams kyi las gang gis mdog dang byad gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par 'byung ba rnams las byung ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa 'degs pa bya ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang rtog pa'i las de'i bag chags gang yin pa de sems can de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de la gnas kyi 'byung ba la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: That is the cause of the consciousness of those sentient beings, but it does not exist in other things such as the primary elements,

original: las kyi dus na sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi dus na sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the karma, the primary elements of the sentient beings of the hells do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la bag chags gnas pa de'i tshe gang la de gnas pa de nyid la de'i de 'dra bar rnam par shes pa gyur par rigs na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la bag chags gnas pa de'i tshe gang la de gnas pa de nyid la de'i de 'dra bar rnam par shes pa gyur par rigs na /
translated: When the latent imprints exist in the continuum of consciousness, it is logical that the consciousness that is similar to it exists in that very place where the latent imprints exist.

original: de yang der khyod mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang der khyod mi 'dod de /
translated: But you do not assert that.

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa gang na bag chags med pa der de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa gang na bag chags med pa der de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
translated: What is the reason for this understanding that the result of the latent impressions exists where they exist, but not where they do not exist?

original: 'jig rten na ni gang dus bon btab pa der 'bras bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gang dus bon btab pa der 'bras bu 'byung ste /
translated: In the world, the result arises where the seed is planted.

original: zhing la sa bon btab la ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: zhing la sa bon btab la ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: The seed is planted in the field, but the result does not arise on the peak of a mountain.

original: 'dir mdo sde bas lung gi gtan tshigs yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni bag chags gzhan na yod la 'bras bu gzhan na med na zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni lung ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde bas lung gi gtan tshigs yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni bag chags gzhan na yod la 'bras bu gzhan na med na zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni lung ste /
translated: Here, the Sutra master says, “There is a reason based on scripture,” and so on. The reason that the latent impressions exist elsewhere but the result does not is scripture.

original: 'di ltar gal te rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i don gud na med na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i don gud na med na ni /
translated: Thus, if consciousness itself appears as the object of form and so on, and form and so on do not exist elsewhere,

original: de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa skye mched bcu po dag yod par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa skye mched bcu po dag yod par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the Bhagavān would not have said that the ten bases of form and so on exist.

original: de bas na kha cig gis ji ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: de bas na kha cig gis ji ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar byas te /
translated: Therefore, some say, “How can the Bhagavān’s words be taken as authoritative here?

original: gzugs la sogs @182a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs @182a * //
translated: Just as you understand that the cause of form, etc.,

original: pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa las gud na yod par khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa las gud na yod par khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
translated: exists separately from consciousness,

original: sems can dmyal ba dag na yang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i khyad par dag logs shig na yod par rtogs te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dag na yang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i khyad par dag logs shig na yod par rtogs te /
translated: in the same way, you should understand that the cause of the eye consciousness, etc., of sentient beings in the hells exists separately from those sentient beings.

original: 'di ni dbang gi 'bras bu yin gyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang gi 'bras bu yin gyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the dominant result, but it is not the result of evolution or the result of natural outcome.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni sa bon dang yul mtshungs par 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni sa bon dang yul mtshungs par 'dod do //
translated: The result of evolution and the result of natural outcome are held to be similar to the seed and the field.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sa bon dang yul mtshungs mi mtshungs 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sa bon dang yul mtshungs mi mtshungs 'gal ba med de /
translated: The dominant result is not contradictory whether or not it is similar to the seed and the field.

original: dper na rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i dbang gis rgyud gzhan la rnam par rig pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i dbang gis rgyud gzhan la rnam par rig pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: For example, the consciousness of one mental continuum arises in another mental continuum by the power of the consciousness of the other mental continuum.

original: de dag ni dbang gi 'bras bu yang yin la yul tha dad pa yang yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba gyur ba tha dad pa yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni dbang gi 'bras bu yang yin la yul tha dad pa yang yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba gyur ba tha dad pa yang 'byung ste /
translated: Just as they are the dominant result and also different objects, so too they arise as different elements.🔽

original: dbang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as these are results of conscious effort and are also different objects, so too, different elements arise, because they are results of conscious effort.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos byed pas /
translated: The author of the treatise states:

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is not a reason, etc.

original: lung 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol yod par rab tu bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: lung 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol yod par rab tu bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: This scripture is not a reason to establish that external form, etc., exist.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yod pa skad du dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yod pa skad du dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs te /
translated: Because the Buddha spoke with an intention, namely, that he spoke of the existence of the sense bases of form, etc., for the sake of those disciples who are disciplined by that teaching.

original: dper na rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: For example, he said, “There are sentient beings who are spontaneously born.” This is the meaning of the summary.

original: bstan bcos byed pas dpe rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas dpe rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: The author of the treatise states:

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, the Bhagavān said, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs pa de yang dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa'o ;🔽/ dgongs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs pa de yang dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa'o ; / dgongs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagavān’s statement that there are sentient beings who are spontaneously born is also a statement made by the power of thought.

original: phyi ma la sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi ma la sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that very thought, he says, “The continuum of mind is uninterrupted in the future,” and so on.

original: sems can kha cig 'di skad du bdag 'di ni 'di nyid du rgyun chad de 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes 'dzer te /
analyzed: sems can kha cig 'di skad du bdag 'di ni 'di nyid du rgyun chad de 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes 'dzer te /
translated: Some sentient beings say, “This self is severed right here. There is no other world.”

original: de dag chad par lta ba des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang de'i 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs shing ci dga' dgur byed do //🔽de bas na lta ba ngan pa'i dri ma de bkru ba'i phyir shi ba'i 'og tu bar mdo'i sring pa zhes bya ba sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: de dag chad par lta ba des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang de'i 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs shing ci dga' dgur byed do // de bas na lta ba ngan pa'i dri ma de bkru ba'i phyir shi ba'i 'og tu bar mdo'i sring pa zhes bya ba sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs te /
translated: Through that view of annihilation, they deny virtuous and nonvirtuous karma and its effects and act as they please.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to wash away that stain of bad views, the Bhagavān, thinking of the continuum of mind that is uninterrupted in the intermediate state after death, said, “There are sentient beings who are spontaneously born.”

original: phyi ma la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du'o //
translated: The latter refers to the next world.

original: dgongs @182b nas zhes bya ba ni ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs @182b nas zhes bya ba ni ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha’s intention is his indirect intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'dis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'dis rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: The Buddha, with this intention, taught that there are sentient beings who are spontaneously born.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na bdag ni med do zhes bya bar 'di ci mngon snyam pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na bdag ni med do zhes bya bar 'di ci mngon snyam pa la /
translated: But how do we know that he taught that ultimately there is no self?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag gam sems can med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag gam sems can med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he said, “There is no self or sentient being here.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ma yin pa gzhan nas chos yod pa 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ma yin pa gzhan nas chos yod pa 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: The Lord taught that these phenomena, which are other than that, have causes.🔽He taught that there is no self or sentient being here.

original: 'di la bdag gam sems can ni med do zhes gsungs pa'i mdo sde de tshad mar byas nas rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod pa skad du bstan pa ni dgongs pa yin par nges so //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam sems can ni med do zhes gsungs pa'i mdo sde de tshad mar byas nas rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod pa skad du bstan pa ni dgongs pa yin par nges so //
translated: We should accept this sutra as authoritative. The teaching that there are sentient beings who are spontaneously born is an indirect teaching.

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde snga ma ni dgongs pa yin la phyi ma ni ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo sde snga ma ni dgongs pa yin la phyi ma ni ma yin zhe na ;
translated: Why is the former sutra an indirect teaching, but not the latter?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar bdag ni rtag pa'i phyir rdzus te byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar bdag ni rtag pa'i phyir rdzus te byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Objection: Because the self is permanent, it is not spontaneously born.

original: 'di ltar gang skye bar 'os pa de rdzus te byung ba zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang skye bar 'os pa de rdzus te byung ba zhes bya na /
translated: In this way, that which is suitable to be born is called “spontaneously born.”

original: bdag ni rtag pa'i phyir ma yin na de las 'os pa zhes bya ba de la ga la yod /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa'i phyir ma yin na de las 'os pa zhes bya ba de la ga la yod /
translated: But because the self is permanent, how could it be suitable to be born?

original: de dag gis na 'di rdzus te byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis na 'di rdzus te byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is not spontaneously born.

original: de ltar dpe bshad nas dngos dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dpe bshad nas dngos dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the example, in order to apply it to the actual point,

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In the same way, the Bhagavān said, ‘The sense bases of form and so on exist’ and so on.”

original: dper na chad par smra ba'i skye bo'i ched du rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yod do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na chad par smra ba'i skye bo'i ched du rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yod do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Just as for the sake of those who propound annihilation, he said, “Beings who are spontaneously born exist,” in the same way, for the sake of those who are disciplined by the teachings on form and so on, he said, “The sense bases of form and so on exist.”

original: bka' de ni dgongs pa can no //
analyzed: bka' de ni dgongs pa can no //
translated: That statement was made with a specific intention.

original: de ni 'di skad du bka' de ni drang ba'i don yin gyi nges pa'i don ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du bka' de ni drang ba'i don yin gyi nges pa'i don ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is to say, it would be taught that this scripture is of provisional meaning, not of definitive meaning.

original: ched du zhes bya ba ni don no /
analyzed: ched du zhes bya ba ni don no /
translated: “ With regard to” means “with respect to the meaning of.”

original: mdo sde pas mdo sde 'di'i dgongs pa 'dri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde pas mdo sde 'di'i dgongs pa 'dri ba'i phyir /
translated: The Sautrantikas ask: What is the intention of this scripture?

original: 'dir ci las dgongs zhes bya bar slos so ;
analyzed: 'dir ci las dgongs zhes bya bar slos so ;
translated: Here, what is the intention?

original: / ji ltar sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs nas rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yong do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par yang ci las dgongs te gsungs pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: / ji ltar sems kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs nas rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yong do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par yang ci las dgongs te gsungs pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Just as the Buddha spoke of the existence of spontaneously born sentient beings with the intention of the uninterrupted continuum of the mind, so here, what is the intention of the Buddha when he speaks of the existence of the sense spheres of form, etc.?

original: bstan bcos byed pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the intention of the treatise author, he says:

original: rang gis bon gang las su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gis bon gang las su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “With regard to the seeds of each of these, etc.”

original: rnam par rig pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon gang las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa byung ba dang snang ba 'byung ba gang yin pa sa bon dang snang ba de dag ni rnam par rig pa de'i
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon gang las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa byung ba dang snang ba 'byung ba gang yin pa sa bon dang snang ba de dag ni rnam par rig pa de'i
translated: The so-called habitual tendencies of consciousness are the seeds from which the consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness arise and the appearances that arise. Those seeds and appearances are the habitual tendencies of consciousness.🔽

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes @183a * //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes @183a * //
translated: The so-called latent impressions of consciousness are the seeds from which the consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness arise, and the appearances that arise. The Blessed One taught that those seeds and appearances are the internal and external sense bases of that consciousness.

original: mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary.

original: de ltar re zhig skye mched bcu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skye mched bcu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: Thus, up to this point, the ten sense bases have been presented for the sake of classification.

original: da ni so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain them individually,

original: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, How will they be explained? and so on.

original: gzugs su snang ba'i mig gi rnam par rig pa rnam par smin pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon yongs su smin par gyur pa gang las byung ba'i sa bon de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rig pa de'i mig gi skye mched du
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba'i mig gi rnam par rig pa rnam par smin pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon yongs su smin par gyur pa gang las byung ba'i sa bon de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rig pa de'i mig gi skye mched du
translated: The so-called latent impressions of the eye consciousness appearing as form are the seeds from which the eye consciousness arises. The Blessed One taught that those seeds are the eye sense base of that consciousness.

original: gsungs so // snang ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs so //
analyzed: gsungs so // snang ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs so //
translated: The appearance that arises is said to be the form base of that.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par rig pa rnams ni rang rang gi sa bon dang / snang ba yang phyi'i skye mched du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par rig pa rnams ni rang rang gi sa bon dang / snang ba yang phyi'i skye mched du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the awarenesses of the ear, nose, tongue, and body should be described as the internal bases, and their seeds and appearances as the external bases.

original: rnam par shes pa las snang ba bzhin ma yin na tha dad par skye mched du ji ltar rnam par gzhag //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las snang ba bzhin ma yin na tha dad par skye mched du ji ltar rnam par gzhag //
translated: If the appearance is not like the consciousness, how can it be posited as a separate base?

original: smras pa / dper na rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs las yid kyi khams gud na med kyang 'bras bu la ltos nas logs shig tu rnam par gzhag pa ltar 'dir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dper na rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs las yid kyi khams gud na med kyang 'bras bu la ltos nas logs shig tu rnam par gzhag pa ltar 'dir yang de bzhin no //
translated: We reply: Just as the mind element is not separate from the collection of the six consciousnesses, but is posited as a separate element in consideration of its effect, so it is here.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dgongs pa dang bcas pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dgongs pa dang bcas pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the intention in this way, in order to summarize,

original: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “This is the intention here.”

original: sa bon dang snang ba la dgongs nas gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod pa skad du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: sa bon dang snang ba la dgongs nas gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod pa skad du gsungs kyi /
translated: The existence of the sense-fields of form, etc. is stated with the intention of the seeds and appearances.

original: de dag rnam par shes pa las gud na yod par ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag rnam par shes pa las gud na yod par ni ma gsungs so //
translated: But it is not stated that they exist apart from consciousness.

original: mdo sde pas dgongs te bstan pa'i dgongs pa dri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde pas dgongs te bstan pa'i dgongs pa dri ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to question the intention of the Sutra master's explanation of the intention,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, In that way...

original: ji ltar rdzus te byung ba'i sems can dgongs te bstan pa'i 'bras bu bshad pa de de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rdzus te byung ba'i sems can dgongs te bstan pa'i 'bras bu bshad pa de de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the result of the explanation of the intention of the sentient beings who are born supernaturally must be stated,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par dgongs te bstan pa'i 'bras bu ci yin pa yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par dgongs te bstan pa'i 'bras bu ci yin pa yang brjod dgos so //
translated: so also the result of the explanation of the intention of the existence of the sense-fields of form, etc. must be stated.

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result, the author of the treatise says,

original: de ltar gang zag bdag med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar gang zag bdag med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In that way, one enters into the selflessness of the person.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very point,

original: de ltar bshad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, If it is explained in that way...

original: gang gi phyir de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis po dag bshad na gang zag dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar skye mched bcu gnyis po dag bshad na gang zag dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the twelve sense-spheres are explained in this way, the person is understood to be a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Non-entity is selflessness.

original: ji ltar zhig gu snyam pa la drug po gnyis las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'di ltar mig la sogs pa nang gi drug po dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi drug po las @183b mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug 'byung gi lta ba bo bdag gcig pu ni yang dag pa'i don du gang
analyzed: ji ltar zhig gu snyam pa la drug po gnyis las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar mig la sogs pa nang gi drug po dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi drug po las @183b mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug 'byung gi lta ba bo bdag gcig pu ni yang dag pa'i don du gang
translated: How is that? From the two sets of six, etc.

original: yang med de /
analyzed: yang med de /
translated: Thus, the six internal ones such as the eye and the six external ones such as form, the six consciousnesses such as eye-consciousness arise. But the self alone is not truly existent as the🔽seer, etc.

original: bdag reg pa po'i bar du yang med do //
analyzed: bdag reg pa po'i bar du yang med do //
translated: up to the feeler.

original: 'di ltar gang dag lta ba la sogs pa byed pa bdag go zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis byed do zhes gang gi tshe bstan par gyur pa de'i tshe gang
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag lta ba la sogs pa byed pa bdag go zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis byed do zhes gang gi tshe bstan par gyur pa de'i tshe gang
translated: Thus, when it is shown that the eyes and so on are the agent of seeing and so on, which are accepted by those who advocate a self as the agent of seeing and so on, then at that time

original: zag la dngos po med par rtogs so //
analyzed: zag la dngos po med par rtogs so //
translated: one realizes that the person is not a thing.

original: de ni 'di skad du skye mched bcu gnyis bstan par 'du byed rnams mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i bdag gis bdag med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du skye mched bcu gnyis bstan par 'du byed rnams mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i bdag gis bdag med par rtogs so //
translated: This is stated as follows: When the twelve bases are taught, one realizes that the formations are not a self that is different from the eyes and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag med par rtogs nas de dag las sems skyo ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag med par rtogs nas de dag las sems skyo ste /
translated: Having realized that the formations are not a self, one becomes disenchanted with them.

original: mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob bo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob bo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the state of the culmination of that.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par grub na sems tsam du bstan pa ci dgos snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par grub na sems tsam du bstan pa ci dgos snyam pa la /
translated: If it is established that one attains nirvana by merely comprehending the selflessness of the person, then what is the point of teaching that there is only mind?

original: de'i phyir gzhan du yang bstan pas chos la bdag med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du yang bstan pas chos la bdag med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, since it is taught elsewhere, he says, “In the absence of self in phenomena,” and so on.

original: gang yang sems tsam du bstan pas des chos la bdag med par 'jug ste /🔽de'i phyir chos la bdag med pa la gzhug pa'i don du sems tsam du bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang sems tsam du bstan pas des chos la bdag med par 'jug ste / de'i phyir chos la bdag med pa la gzhug pa'i don du sems tsam du bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Also, since it is taught that there is mind only, one enters into the absence of self in phenomena.🔽Therefore, mind only is taught for the purpose of introducing one to the absence of self in phenomena.

original: 'dir 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: Here, one is introduced to the absence of self in phenomena by the teaching of mind only.

original: khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Introduction” means “understanding.”

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the word “elsewhere,”

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In other scriptures,” and so on.

original: de ni go sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bsam bshad do //
translated: This is easy to understand and so I will not comment on it.

original: sems tsam du bstan pas chos la bdag med par 'jug pa yid ma ches nas ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'jug ces dris te /
analyzed: sems tsam du bstan pas chos la bdag med par 'jug pa yid ma ches nas ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'jug ces dris te /
translated: Not believing that one enters into the absence of self in phenomena by the teaching of mind only, he asks, “How does one enter into the absence of self in phenomena?”

original: bstan pa 'dis ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'dis ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'jug ce na /
translated: “ By this teaching, how does one enter into the absence of self in phenomena?”

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'jug pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'jug pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the method of entering into the absence of self in phenomena, the author of the treatise says,🔽“The absence of self in phenomena is taught by the teaching of mind only.”

original: rnam par rig pa tsam 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is what is meant by “this mere representation.”

original: rnam par rig pa tsam 'di nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par gyur nas byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam 'di nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par gyur nas byung ste /
translated: This mere representation appears as form, etc.

original: sems la sa logs shig na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chos gang yang med par gang gi tshe /
analyzed: sems la sa logs shig na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chos gang yang med par gang gi tshe /
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever, other than mind, that has the nature of form, etc.

original: de ltar rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe chos la bdag med pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe chos la bdag med pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: When one realizes this, one enters into the selflessness of dharmas.

original: chos la bdag med par zhugs na byang chub sems dpa' @184a * //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par zhugs na byang chub sems dpa' @184a * //
translated: When one enters into the selflessness of dharmas, the bodhisattvas

original: rnams rim gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnams rim gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'thob bo //
translated: gradually attain the state of a tathāgata.

original: de bas na don 'di ni gtso bo zhes bya'o zhes de lta bu'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na don 'di ni gtso bo zhes bya'o zhes de lta bu'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this meaning is called the principal one. The Bhagavat taught mind only for this meaning.

original: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med pa rnam pa thams cad du gang zag dngos po med pa de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa yang rnam pa thams cad du chos med pa lta bur rigs nas gzhan gyis brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag la bdag med pa rnam pa thams cad du gang zag dngos po med pa de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa yang rnam pa thams cad du chos med pa lta bur rigs nas gzhan gyis brgal ba'i phyir /
