translated: Just as the selflessness of persons is the non-existence of the person in every way, so too the selflessness of phenomena is the non-existence of phenomena in every way.

original: gal te chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to respond to the objection that this is illogical, he says:

original: gal te chos med pa chos la bdag med pa yin na ni rnam pa thams cad du chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: gal te chos med pa chos la bdag med pa yin na ni rnam pa thams cad du chos gang yang med do //
translated: If the non-existence of phenomena is the selflessness of phenomena, then phenomena do not exist in any way.

original: de lta na ni sems tsam de yang med de /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems tsam de yang med de /
translated: In that case, even mind-only does not exist.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be posited?

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here the master says:

original: thams cad du thams cad chos gang yang med pa de lta bu ni chos la bdag med pa la 'jug pa ma yin gyi kun brtags pa'i chos med pas chos la bdag med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad chos gang yang med pa de lta bu ni chos la bdag med pa la 'jug pa ma yin gyi kun brtags pa'i chos med pas chos la bdag med pa la 'jug go /
translated: It is not that the selflessness of phenomena is the non-existence of phenomena in every way, but rather the selflessness of phenomena is the non-existence of imputed phenomena.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo de la yang ji lta bu snyam pa la gang byis pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo de la yang ji lta bu snyam pa la gang byis pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The nature of the imagined is also asked about, beginning with What is that?

original: gang so so'i skye bo rnams kyis chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid des de dag bdag med kyi /
analyzed: gang so so'i skye bo rnams kyis chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid des de dag bdag med kyi /
translated: That which is imagined by ordinary beings as the nature of phenomena, characterized by the apprehended and apprehender, is the self-nature imagined as the apprehended and apprehender. By that, they are selfless.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul brjod du med pa gang yin pa yang med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul brjod du med pa gang yin pa yang med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the inexpressible object of the Buddhas is not non-existent.

original: de ni 'di skad du de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyi gang chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa de dag gi de med kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyi gang chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa de dag gi de med kyi /
translated: This is what is being said: For those who have not seen reality, that which is imagined as the entity of the apprehended and apprehender in phenomena does not exist.

original: de dag gi gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni med pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni med pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But the dependent nature and the perfected nature that are the objects of the wisdom of the Tathagatas do exist.

original: 'di ltar chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa tsam la mi bya'i gnas kyi khyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa tsam la mi bya'i gnas kyi khyad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the term “selflessness of phenomena” is not used to refer to mere nonexistence, but to a specific basis.

original: 'di ltar de nyid la tshig 'di ltar rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid la tshig 'di ltar rnam par sbyar te /
translated: This is how the term is applied:

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag dang bral ba de bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag dang bral ba de bdag med pa'o //
translated: The dependent nature and the perfected nature are free from the self that is characterized by the grasped and the grasper. That is selflessness.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is selflessness.

original: chos rnams la bdag med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang yang yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams la bdag med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang yang yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the absence of the grasped and the grasper in the dependent nature and the perfected nature.

original: de bas na @184b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la bdag med pa zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na @184b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la bdag med pa zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the selflessness of mind and mental factors is their freedom from the grasped and the grasper.

original: med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they are nonexistent.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gang zag med pa tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gang zag med pa tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: The selflessness of persons is not merely the absence of persons.

original: 'du byed rnams la gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag med do //
translated: There is no person imagined by others in the compounded.

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni brjod par mi nus par rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni brjod par mi nus par rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “by virtue of its inexpressible nature” means that it is by virtue of its inexpressible essence.

original: chos la bdag med pa rnam pa de lta bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa rnam pa de lta bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the virtues of apprehending the selflessness of dharmas in this way, he says,

original: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “In the same way, one should understand that even consciousness only . . .”

original: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa la chos la bdag med par yongs su 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa la chos la bdag med par yongs su 'dzin na /
translated: If one apprehends the selflessness of dharmas in the absence of grasped and grasper,

original: de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang de ma yin pa sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang bral bar khong du chud pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba sems
analyzed: de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang de ma yin pa sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang bral bar khong du chud pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba sems
translated: then at that time, by understanding that mind and mental factors are also devoid of the nature of grasped and grasper, which is imagined by other minds and mental factors, one should understand that mind and mental factors are devoid of grasped and grasper.

original: dang sems las byung ba tsam du rnam par gzhag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dang sems las byung ba tsam du rnam par gzhag pa med pa yin no //
translated: and as mere mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar rnam par gzhag pas chos thams cad la bdag med par 'ju pa yin gyi chos yod pa rnams la yang rnam pa thams cad du skur pas ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar rnam par gzhag pas chos thams cad la bdag med par 'ju pa yin gyi chos yod pa rnams la yang rnam pa thams cad du skur pas ma yin no //
translated: He is absorbed in the selflessness of all things by positing mind and mental factors as devoid of subject and object, but he does not in any way deny the existence of things.

original: ji ste de ltar mi 'dod na ci nyes snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ste de ltar mi 'dod na ci nyes snyam pa la /
translated: If one does not accept this, what is the problem?

original: de'i phyir gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “Otherwise, etc.

original: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag bral ba ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag bral ba ma yin na ni /
translated: If mind and mental factors are not devoid of self by the nature of subject and object imagined by another,

original: de'i tshe rnam par rig pa gzhan gyi don du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par rig pa gzhan gyi don du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time one would accept consciousness for the sake of another.

original: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam du mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, one would not establish mere consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rig pa rnams don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa rnams don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because the representations are endowed with objects.

original: 'di ltar don dang ldan pa ni de'i tshe rnam par rig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dang ldan pa ni de'i tshe rnam par rig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, if they are endowed with objects, they do not become representations at that time.

original: de lta na yang rnam par rig pa tsam du 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par rig pa tsam du 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But even so, how can the establishment of representation-only be demonstrated?

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgra ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag la bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgra ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag la bya na /
translated: In this way, the term “representation-only” refers to mind and the mental factors that are free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig de dag 'dzin tam /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig de dag 'dzin tam /
translated: If someone grasps them,

original: gal te gzhan dag la yang 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa tsam dug la @185a * //
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag la yang 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa tsam dug la @185a * //
translated: or if others grasp them, then at that time the establishment of representation-only is demonstrated.

original: 'grub / 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po 'ba' zhig la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dgag pa ni ma yin gyi chos thams cad la'o //
analyzed: 'grub / 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po 'ba' zhig la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dgag pa ni ma yin gyi chos thams cad la'o //
translated: In this way, the negation of the grasped and the grasper is not only in regard to the form heap, but in regard to all dharmas.

original: da'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, mind and the mental factors are also free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad la bdag med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad la bdag med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established that all phenomena are devoid of self.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dngos po med par da dung gi bar du rigs pa 'ga' yang ma brjod pas de'i phyir 'dir phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyir gzhil ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dngos po med par da dung gi bar du rigs pa 'ga' yang ma brjod pas de'i phyir 'dir phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyir gzhil ba'i phyir /
translated: So far, no reasoning at all has been stated to prove the non-entityness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject. Therefore, in order to refute the proponents of external objects,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the root text says, “The Bhagavān stated the intention behind this . . .”

original: rang gis bon dang snang ba la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i don du yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin
analyzed: rang gis bon dang snang ba la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod par gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i don du yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag rnam par rig pa rnams kyi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin
translated: The Bhagavān stated that the sense spheres of form and so on exist with the intention of the seeds and appearances. However, form and so on that exist in an ultimate sense are not objects that are the bases of consciousness.

original: no zhes bya ba ci mngon /🔽de ni 'di skad du sgra ji bzhin du na /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba ci mngon / de ni 'di skad du sgra ji bzhin du na /
translated: What is the evidence for this?

original: gal te 'dir 'ga' zhig rigs pa dang 'gal na ni de'i tshe dgongs pa can du yang brtags pa'i yang rigs na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir 'ga' zhig rigs pa dang 'gal na ni de'i tshe dgongs pa can du yang brtags pa'i yang rigs na /
translated: This is what it means: If it were the case that the Bhagavān’s statements about form and so on were literal,🔽then it would follow that the Bhagavān’s statements about form and so on are not statements that have an ulterior implication.

original: 'di la ni sgra ji bzhin du na rigs pa dang 'gal ba 'ga' yang med na ci'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa can du yongs su brtag ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la ni sgra ji bzhin du na rigs pa dang 'gal ba 'ga' yang med na ci'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa can du yongs su brtag ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, there is no contradiction with reason whatsoever in the literal sense, so why imagine a special intention?

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis rigs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis rigs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the Master, in order to demonstrate the contradiction with reason,🔽says,

original: 'di ltar / de ni gcig na na 'ang yul min la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni gcig na na 'ang yul min la //
translated: “It is not an object when it is one,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rags pa de gcig pu yang yul ma yin no //🔽rdul phra rab phrag can du gnas pa du ma yang yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rags pa de gcig pu yang yul ma yin no // rdul phra rab phrag can du gnas pa du ma yang yul ma yin no //
translated: That gross form, etc. is not an object when it is one.🔽Nor is it an object when it is many, i.e., when it is composed of many atoms.

original: rdul phra rab de dag med par gnas pa yang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag med par gnas pa yang yul ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it an object when it is not composed of atoms, i.e., when it is not composed of atoms.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: In this way, the meaning of the summary is that the atom itself is not established.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdar byas pa'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdar byas pa'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate extensively the meaning of the summary by the treatise-maker,

original: ji skad du bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “How is it to be demonstrated?” and so on.

original: gang khyed kyi rnam par shes pa las logs shig na /🔽gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa so so'i yul du khas blangs pa de gcig pu zhig yin na bye brag pa rnams kyi cha shas kyi ngo bor rags pa khyon che ba dbang po'i blo gzung bar
analyzed: gang khyed kyi rnam par shes pa las logs shig na / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa so so'i yul du khas blangs pa de gcig pu zhig yin na bye brag pa rnams kyi cha shas kyi ngo bor rags pa khyon che ba dbang po'i blo gzung bar
translated: If you say that the object of cognition is not separate from consciousness,🔽and that the object of cognition is a single form, sound, etc.,🔽then the object of cognition is either a gross object that is a composite of subtle particles, as the Vaiśeṣikas assert,

original: 'dod pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa lta bu'am /
translated: or it is many subtle particles that exist in a cluster, as the Sāṃkhyas assert.

original: phrag @185b yod par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab du ma yul du 'dod dam /
analyzed: phrag @185b yod par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab du ma yul du 'dod dam /
translated: If you say that the object of cognition is the many subtle particles that exist in a cluster,

original: de ste phan tshun ltos pa dang cas pa'i rdul phra rab de dag nyid 'dus pa dag du 'dod grang na /
analyzed: de ste phan tshun ltos pa dang cas pa'i rdul phra rab de dag nyid 'dus pa dag du 'dod grang na /
translated: then in that case, the object of cognition is the many subtle particles that exist in a cluster.

original: phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In the first case,

original: gcig pu de ni yul ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gcig pu de ni yul ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, “That single object is not the object of cognition.”

original: cha shas can zhes bya ba gcig pu ni yul ma yin te /
analyzed: cha shas can zhes bya ba gcig pu ni yul ma yin te /
translated: A single object that is a composite of parts is not the object of cognition.

original: 'di ltar cha shas rnams las ma gtogs pa cha shas can gzhan gang la yang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar cha shas rnams las ma gtogs pa cha shas can gzhan gang la yang mi 'dzin te /
translated: In this way, apart from the parts, the composite of parts is not apprehended as another thing.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la yang nges cha dang rgyu skud pa la sogs pa'i cha shas nyid la 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la yang nges cha dang rgyu skud pa la sogs pa'i cha shas nyid la 'dzin gyi /
translated: Also, in the case of all things such as a pot and a cloth, one apprehends only the parts such as the neck and the yarn.

original: de dag las gud na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de dag las gud na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par mi 'dzin to //
translated: One does not apprehend a pot or a cloth apart from those.

original: phyogs gnyis pa bstsal pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa bstsal pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the second position,

original: du ma yang yul ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: du ma yang yul ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “Nor is a multiplicity an object.”

original: du ma phrag can du gnas pa yang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma phrag can du gnas pa yang yul ma yin te /
translated: A multiplicity that exists as a collection is not an object.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab so so la 'dzin par khas mi len to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab so so la 'dzin par khas mi len to //
translated: Thus, one does not accept that each atom is apprehended.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs ni bsags pa la dmigs so zhes gzhan dag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs ni bsags pa la dmigs so zhes gzhan dag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, others accept that the five collections of consciousness have a collection as their object.

original: phyogs gsum pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to refute the third position,

original: de dag 'dus pa yang yul ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa yang yul ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Nor is the aggregation of those an object,” and so on.

original: phan tshun nas nye ste bar med par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab dag kyang yul ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun nas nye ste bar med par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab dag kyang yul ma yin te /
translated: Atoms that exist without an interstice, that is, without an interval between them, are not an object.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab ces bya ba gang yang rdzas gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te rdul phra rab dag rdzas su yod par grub na ni de'i phyir ci de dag 'dus pa yul yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab ces bya ba gang yang rdzas gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro // gal te rdul phra rab dag rdzas su yod par grub na ni de'i phyir ci de dag 'dus pa yul yin nam /
translated: Thus, what is called an atom is not established as a single substance.

original: 'on te phrag can du gnas pa zhes bsam par yang bya na de dag ni rdzas yod par ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'on te phrag can du gnas pa zhes bsam par yang bya na de dag ni rdzas yod par ma grub bo //
translated: If it were established that atoms exist as substances, then it would be possible to consider whether they are objects when they are aggregated or when they are dispersed. But they are not established as existing as substances.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rdul phra rab ma grub par yid mi ches nas ji ltar mi 'grub ces dris te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rdul phra rab ma grub par yid mi ches nas ji ltar mi 'grub ces dris te /
translated: The proponents of external objects, not believing that atoms are not established, ask, “How are they not established?”

original: ma grub pa'i rgyu gang yang mi snang ngo snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i rgyu gang yang mi snang ngo snyam du sems so //
translated: They think that no reason for their nonestablishment appears.

original: slob dpon gyis ma grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ma grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] states the reason for their nonestablishment:

original: 'di ltar drug gis gcig car sbyar ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar drug gis gcig car sbyar ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Thus, when six are simultaneously applied to one.”

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very point, he says,

original: phyogs drug nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyogs drug nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “From the six directions,” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab la phyogs drug nas 'ongs pa'i rdul phra rab drug gis cig car du sbyar ba de'i tshe phyogs gzhan dang gzhan dag nas sbyar tam /🔽'on te gcig kho na nas sbyar zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab la phyogs drug nas 'ongs pa'i rdul phra rab drug gis cig car du sbyar ba de'i tshe phyogs gzhan dang gzhan dag nas sbyar tam / 'on te gcig kho na nas sbyar zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: When the subtle particle in the middle is simultaneously joined by six subtle particles coming from the six directions, then is it joined from the other directions or not?

original: gal te rdul phra rab drug po dag gis @186a * //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab drug po dag gis @186a * //
translated: If the six subtle particles

original: gzhan dang gzhan dag nas cig car du sbyar na ni de'i tshe dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan dag nas cig car du sbyar na ni de'i tshe dbus na 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: simultaneously join from the other directions, then the subtle particle in the middle would have six parts.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why?

original: gcig gi go gang yin pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gcig gi go gang yin pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “where there is one, there is no place for another.”

original: 'di ltar dbus su 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs kyi dos la 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab gcig gis non pa gang yin pa de'i rdul phra rab gzhan go skabs med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbus su 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs kyi dos la 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab gcig gis non pa gang yin pa de'i rdul phra rab gzhan go skabs med de /
translated: Thus, where the subtle particle in the middle is covered by one subtle particle situated in the middle, there is no place for another subtle particle.

original: de'i phyir de ni phyogs gzhan du gnas par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni phyogs gzhan du gnas par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be situated in another direction.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du cha drug tu grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du cha drug tu grub bo //
translated: The other parts are also established in the same way.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab cha drug 'dus par gyur na des de rdzas su yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab cha drug 'dus par gyur na des de rdzas su yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the subtle particle is composed of six parts, how can it be substantially existent?

original: phyogs gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the second position,

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If the six are in one place,” and so on.

original: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this,

original: ji ste rdul phra rab gcig gi go gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ste rdul phra rab gcig gi go gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If the place of one subtle particle is the place of the other six,” and so on.

original: ji ste dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gcig gi go gang yin pa de nyid ngos la 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab drug po rnams kyi go yang yin na ni des na rdul phra rab mang po rnam pa go gcig pa'i phyir gong bu thams cad rdul🔽phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gcig gi go gang yin pa de nyid ngos la 'dug pa'i rdul phra rab drug po rnams kyi go yang yin na ni des na rdul phra rab mang po rnam pa go gcig pa'i phyir gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: If the place of one subtle particle in the middle is the place of the other six subtle particles in the directions, then because many subtle particles have one place, the entire mass would be the size of a single subtle particle.

original: tshul 'dis ri rab la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul 'dis ri rab la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By this method, even Mount Meru and so on would become a subtle particle.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la phan tshun du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la phan tshun du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain why, he says, “because there is no difference between them, etc.”

original: 'di ltar phyogs 'di la rdul phra rab thams cad kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs 'di la rdul phra rab thams cad kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med de /
translated: Thus, in this position, all atoms are not different from each other.

original: de'i phyir de'i gong bu gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gong bu gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, no composite of them would appear,

original: ri rab kyang snang bar mi 'gyur bar 'dod do //
analyzed: ri rab kyang snang bar mi 'gyur bar 'dod do //
translated: and even Mount Meru would not appear.

original: phyogs dang po ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first position is that it exists substantially because it has parts.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ni cha shas med pa'i phyir sogs pa yod par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ni cha shas med pa'i phyir sogs pa yod par mi 'grub bo //
translated: The second position is that it is not established as existing because it has no parts.

original: de bas na snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it does not appear. This is the summarized meaning.

original: phyogs dang po la bye brag tu smra bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la bye brag tu smra bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: To answer the first position, the Vaibhāṣika say:

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Atoms, etc.”

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams sbyor na ni de'i phyir drug gis cig car du sbyor bas cha drug tu yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams sbyor na ni de'i phyir drug gis cig car du sbyor bas cha drug tu yang 'gyur na /
translated: If the subtle particles were to join, then because of the simultaneous joining of six, there would be six parts.

original: de dag ni cha shas med pa'i phyir mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: de dag ni cha shas med pa'i phyir mi sbyor ro //
translated: But they do not join because they are partless.

original: de bas na 'di la cha drug gi nyes par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la cha drug gi nyes par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of six parts in this.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi sbyor na gang sbyar bar byed pa de gang gi yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi sbyor na gang sbyar bar byed pa de gang gi yin snyam pa la /
translated: If the subtle particles do not join, then what joins is that of what?

original: 'dus pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa @186b smos te 'dus pa dag ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir phan tshun sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa @186b smos te 'dus pa dag ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir phan tshun sbyor ro //
translated: The treatise mentions “aggregates” and so on. Aggregates join with each other because they have parts.

original: de bas na grags pa dang mi 'gal lo snyam du khas 'che ba'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams sems so //🔽bstan bcos byed pas de bas la ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na grags pa dang mi 'gal lo snyam du khas 'che ba'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams sems so // bstan bcos byed pas de bas la ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Vaibhāṣikas think that this does not contradict what is well known.

original: de dag la 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The author of the treatise says this to them.

original: bye brag tu smra ba de dag la 'di skad du rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa gang yin pa de rdul phra rab rnams las gzhan nam 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o //🔽gal te don tha dad pa ma yin no zhes zer na de la nyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba de dag la 'di skad du rdul phra rab rnams 'dus pa gang yin pa de rdul phra rab rnams las gzhan nam 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o // gal te don tha dad pa ma yin no zhes zer na de la nyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas should be asked this: Is that which is an aggregation of subtle atoms different from the subtle atoms or not?

original: rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If they say that it is not different, then in order to show the fault in that, it is said:

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi sbyor la /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi sbyor la /
translated: “If the subtle atoms are not joined,

original: 'dus pa'i yang de las don gzhan du mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'dus pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de dag gang gi yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i yang de las don gzhan du mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'dus pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de dag gang gi yin par 'dod /
translated: and the aggregation is not asserted to be different from them, then what is the aggregation that is joined?

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the subtle atoms,

original: cha shas med pa dang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa dang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are partless and not accepted to be joined.

original: de ni 'dus pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dus pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the aggregation,

original: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not asserted to be different from them.

original: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa ni de las ma byung bas 'bras bu khas blang du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa ni de las ma byung bas 'bras bu khas blang du mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is not different from them, it is not suitable to accept it as a result that arises from them.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba de gang gi yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba de gang gi yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that this is the application of what?

original: mdor byas pa snga ma las byed pa'i tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor byas pa snga ma las byed pa'i tshig khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to extract the verbal root “to apply” from the previous summary,

original: sbyor ba zhes bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya bar snyegs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “it is applied.”

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since this is easy to understand, it is not explained.

original: brgya la bye brag tu smra ba de dag nyes pa des 'jigs te 'dus pa yang sbyor bar mi 'dod du dogs nas /
analyzed: brgya la bye brag tu smra ba de dag nyes pa des 'jigs te 'dus pa yang sbyor bar mi 'dod du dogs nas /
translated: Fearing that fault, the Vaibhāṣikas may not accept that the collection is applied.

original: cha shas yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: cha shas yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “because it does not have parts,” and so on.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely unravel that,

original: ji ste 'dus pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ste 'dus pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If the collection is not applied,” and so on.

original: ji ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes te 'dus pa dag kyang phan tshun mi sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes te 'dus pa dag kyang phan tshun mi sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, “This fault may arise, so the collection is not mutually applied,”🔽then do not say, “Because the subtle particles are partless, they are not applied.”

original: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa'i phyir sbyor ba med do zhes ma zer cig / ci'i phyir mi brjod snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa'i phyir sbyor ba med do zhes ma zer cig / ci'i phyir mi brjod snyam pa la /
translated: Why not say that?

original: 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says “an aggregate that has parts” and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa yang sbyor bas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa yang sbyor bas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an aggregate that has parts is not accepted as a conjunction.

original: gal te 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa sbyor bar mi 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa cha shas dang bcas pa sbyor bar mi 'dod na ni /
translated: If you do not assert that an aggregate that has parts is a conjunction,

original: de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'grub bo zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so //🔽gang gi tshe cha shas dang bcas pa yang mi 'dod pa de'i tshe cha shas med pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i @187a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'grub bo zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so // gang gi tshe cha shas dang bcas pa yang mi 'dod pa de'i tshe cha shas med pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i @187a * //
translated: then it is unreasonable to say that atoms are not established as a conjunction because they are partless.🔽When you do not assert that they have parts, then do not say that partlessness is a reason for the absence of conjunction.

original: gtan tshigs yin no zhes ma zer cig / de'i phyir de ltar bye brag tu smra ba bsal nas snga ma'i skabs mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin no zhes ma zer cig / de'i phyir de ltar bye brag tu smra ba bsal nas snga ma'i skabs mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, having refuted the Vaibhāṣika in this way, in order to conclude the previous section,

original: de bas na rdul phra rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “Therefore atoms are not a conjunction” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar drug gis cig car du sbyar bas rdul phra rab cha shas drug tu 'gyur ba de'i phyir rdul phra rab rdzas gcig tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar drug gis cig car du sbyar bas rdul phra rab cha shas drug tu 'gyur ba de'i phyir rdul phra rab rdzas gcig tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since the six directions are simultaneously applied in this way, the subtle particle would have six parts. Therefore, the subtle particle is not established as a single substance.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyogs ltar na yang gong bu thams cad mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs te bshad zin to //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyogs ltar na yang gong bu thams cad mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs te bshad zin to //
translated: Also, when the position of partlessness is taken, it is reasonable that all extended objects would not appear, as has been explained.

original: yang rdul phra rab bstsal ba'i phyir rdul phra rab sbyor bar 'dod kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang rdul phra rab bstsal ba'i phyir rdul phra rab sbyor bar 'dod kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, it is said, “Even if you assert that the subtle particle is connected…”

original: rdul phra rab sbyor bar 'dod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab sbyor bar 'dod kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if you assert that the subtle particle is connected,

original: sbyor bar 'dod pa 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: sbyor bar 'dod pa 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of this assertion of connection?

original: ye ni gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi cha tha dad par khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ye ni gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi cha tha dad par khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that the subtle particle has different directional parts,🔽then it is not suitable to be one,

original: gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
analyzed: gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
translated: because that which has different directional parts

original: de ni gcig tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu mi rung ngo //
translated: is not suitable to be one.

original: phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: If you assert that it has different directional parts,🔽then it is not suitable to be one.

original: rdul phra rab kyi shar phyogs kyi cha yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi shar phyogs kyi cha yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The eastern part of the atom is different, etc.

original: phyogs kyis mtshon pa'i cha ni phyogs kyi cha ste de yang shar phyogs kyis mtshon pa yang gzhan pa nas 'og gi phyogs kyis mtshon pa'i bar du yang gzhan no //
analyzed: phyogs kyis mtshon pa'i cha ni phyogs kyi cha ste de yang shar phyogs kyis mtshon pa yang gzhan pa nas 'og gi phyogs kyis mtshon pa'i bar du yang gzhan no //
translated: The part of the atom that is indicated by the directions is the directional part. The eastern part is indicated by the east, etc.

original: de ltar phyogs kyi cha tha dad na cha du ma yod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pur ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs kyi cha tha dad na cha du ma yod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pur ji ltar rung /
translated: If the directional parts are different, then the atom has many parts. How can it be unitary?

original: de ni 'di skad du gang la cha de dag yod pa ni cha las logs shig na gzhan gang yang med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang la cha de dag yod pa ni cha las logs shig na gzhan gang yang med de /
translated: This is what is being said: “That in which those parts exist is not different from the parts in any way.

original: de'i phyir cha 'dus pa tsam gyi rdul phra rab de gcig tu ga la 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir cha 'dus pa tsam gyi rdul phra rab de gcig tu ga la 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, how can the atom be unitary, which is merely a collection of parts?”

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the following is the case:

original: rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa med do snyam pa la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa med do snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that the atom does not have different directional parts.

original: de'i phyir grib ma dang sgrib par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir grib ma dang sgrib par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “How can there be shadow and obstruction?”

original: cha med pa'i rdul phra rab la grib ma dang sgrib pa mi 'grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: cha med pa'i rdul phra rab la grib ma dang sgrib pa mi 'grub bo zhes mdor byas pa'i don bsdus pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the Abhidharma treatise is summarized in this way: “Shadow and obstruction are not established for partless subtle particles.”

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain extensively the meaning of the Abhidharma treatise,

original: gal te rdul phra rab re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: it says, “If each subtle particle . . .” and so on.

original: / gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa med na de'i dus na nyi ma shar ba'i tshe ngos gcig la grib ma 'bab pa gcig tu nyi ma shar bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: / gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa med na de'i dus na nyi ma shar ba'i tshe ngos gcig la grib ma 'bab pa gcig tu nyi ma shar bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If subtle particles are partless, then since there are no different directional parts, how could it be that when the sun rises at one time, there is shadow in one place and sunlight in another?

original: de ltar 'gyur du mi rung ba ci yod snyam pa la de'i phyir de la ni gang du nyi ma mi 'bab pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa @187b smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur du mi rung ba ci yod snyam pa la de'i phyir de la ni gang du nyi ma mi 'bab pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa @187b smos te /
translated: What is wrong with it being that way? Therefore it says, “In that case, where would there be . . .” and so on.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab de la gang nyi mas gsal bar ma gyur pa'i phyogs gzhan ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab de la gang nyi mas gsal bar ma gyur pa'i phyogs gzhan ni gang yang med do //
translated: In this way, there is no other place in that subtle particle that is not illuminated by the sun.

original: de ltar ri zhig grib ma med par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar ri zhig grib ma med par bstan to //
translated: In this way, it is shown that a mountain without shadow is impossible.

original: sgrib pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gal te phyogs kyi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgrib pa med par bstan pa'i phyir / gal te phyogs kyi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not obstructed, he says:

original: gal te cha shad med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi cha tha dad par mi 'dod na de'i tshe rdul phra rab de la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis sgrib par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te cha shad med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi cha tha dad par mi 'dod na de'i tshe rdul phra rab de la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis sgrib par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you do not accept that the partless particle has different parts because it has no parts, then how can it be that one particle is obstructed by another particle?

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab gang la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab gang la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says:

original: 'di ltar cha gzhan gang la rdul gzhan 'ongs pas rdul gzhan thogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i cha gzhan ni rdul phra rab la gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar cha gzhan gang la rdul gzhan 'ongs pas rdul gzhan thogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i cha gzhan ni rdul phra rab la gang yang med do //
translated: Since there is no other part of the particle to which another particle could come and by which another particle could be obstructed, there is no part of the particle at all.

original: gal te thogs pa med na ci nyes snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te thogs pa med na ci nyes snyam pa la /
translated: If it is not obstructed, what is the problem?

original: de'i phyir / thogs pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thogs pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says:

original: gal te rdul phra rab la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis thogs par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis thogs par mi byed na /
translated: If the particle is not obstructed by another particle,🔽then it follows that the particles are not joined.

original: de'i tshe rdul phra rab thams cad go gcig tu 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul phra rab thams cad go gcig tu 'gyur te ;
translated: At that time, all the subtle particles would be in one place.

original: de'i phyir / thams cad go gcig tu gyur pas ri rab la sogs pa gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / thams cad go gcig tu gyur pas ri rab la sogs pa gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since all are in one place, all the masses such as Mount Meru would become the size of a subtle particle.

original: de ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas 'gro ba'i tshul du grib ma dang sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas 'gro ba'i tshul du grib ma dang sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The proponents of external objects say that there is no error because of the mode of going, such as the shadow and obstruction.

original: gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med pa'i phyir grib ma dang sgrib pa mi rigs kyang gong bu cha shas dang bcas pa de yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med pa'i phyir grib ma dang sgrib pa mi rigs kyang gong bu cha shas dang bcas pa de yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod na /
translated: If it is illogical for a subtle particle to have a shadow and obstruction because it is partless, why do you not assert that a mass that has parts has them?

original: bstan bcos byed pas gong bu dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas gong bu dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the treatise writer analyzes the mass,

original: rdul phra rab rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If the mass is different from the subtle particles,” and so on.

original: kye khyed rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan zhig yin par 'dod dam ci na grib ma dang sgrib pa de dag de'i yin par 'dod /
analyzed: kye khyed rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan zhig yin par 'dod dam ci na grib ma dang sgrib pa de dag de'i yin par 'dod /
translated: Oh, do you assert that the mass is different from the subtle particles, since you assert that the shadow and obstruction are of that?

original: ga lte de dag las de gzhan yin na ni de ltar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: ga lte de dag las de gzhan yin na ni de ltar yang rung ngo //
translated: If it is different from them, then it is suitable.

original: mdo sde pas smras pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mdo sde pas smras pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Sautrāntika says, “It is not so.”

original: kho bo ni gong bu rdul phra rab las gzhan yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni gong bu rdul phra rab las gzhan yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not assert that the composite is different from the subtle particles.

original: bstan bcos byed pas /🔽gong bu gzhan min de de'i ming /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas / gong bu gzhan min de de'i ming /
translated: The author of the treatise says:🔽The composite is not different from that.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That is its name.

original: de gnyis dgrol ba'i phyir gal te rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de gnyis dgrol ba'i phyir gal te rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to explain those two, he says, “If the composite is not different from the subtle particles,” and so on.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan yin par mi 'dod na ni grib ma dang sgrib pa dag gong bu de'i yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams las gong bu gzhan yin par mi 'dod na ni grib ma dang sgrib pa dag gong bu de'i yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: If the composite is not asserted to be different from the subtle particles, then the shadow and the obstruction are established as being of that composite.🔽The external object proponents

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas @188a * //🔽slar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas @188a * // slar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: argue again:

original: yongs su rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The author of the treatise says, “This conception,” and so on.

original: dper na cha shas gnas pa ji lta bu zhig gis gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'khor lo zhes brjod kyang /
analyzed: dper na cha shas gnas pa ji lta bu zhig gis gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'khor lo zhes brjod kyang /
translated: For example, even though one says “wheel” in regard to form, etc., which exist in the manner of the existence of parts,🔽those are not the nature of a wheel.🔽In the same way, at the end of the destruction of form, etc., what are called “atoms” do not exist.

original: de dag 'khor lo'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa zhig pa'i mthar phyin pa la ni rdul phra rab dag ces bya bar med par gnas pa dag la ni 'dus pa zhes bya yang de dag ni rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo
analyzed: de dag 'khor lo'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa zhig pa'i mthar phyin pa la ni rdul phra rab dag ces bya bar med par gnas pa dag la ni 'dus pa zhes bya yang de dag ni rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo
translated: What are called “aggregates” are those that remain without being destroyed.

original: nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: But they are not the nature of atoms.

original: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are also not the nature of aggregates.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni ma bkag na rdul phra rab ces sam 'dus pa zhes bsam pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni ma bkag na rdul phra rab ces sam 'dus pa zhes bsam pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, if the characteristic of form, etc. is not refuted, what is the use of thinking in terms of “atoms” or “aggregates”?

original: de ma bkag pas phyi rol gyi don yang ma bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma bkag pas phyi rol gyi don yang ma bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since that is not refuted, external objects are also not refuted.

original: bstan bcos byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dri ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ask about the characteristic of form, etc., the author of the treatise says,

original: de dag ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “What is their characteristic?”

original: kye gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin smos shig / phyi rol gyi don du smra bas /
analyzed: kye gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin smos shig / phyi rol gyi don du smra bas /
translated: Oh, tell me what the characteristics of form and so on are!🔽The proponents of external objects say:

original: mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The objects of the eye and so on.

original: spyir na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul nyid gzugs la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang bye brag tu na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa nyid ni de dag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyir na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul nyid gzugs la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang bye brag tu na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa nyid ni de dag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: In general, the objects of the sense faculties such as the eye are form and so on. Specifically, blue, yellow, and so on are their characteristics.

original: bstan bcos byed pas gang mig la sogs pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽khyod kyis gang mig la sogs pa'i yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa 'dod pa de ci //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas gang mig la sogs pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // khyod kyis gang mig la sogs pa'i yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa 'dod pa de ci //
translated: The author of the treatise says, What are the objects of the eye and so on?

original: cha shas can zhes bya ba rdzas gcig bu zhig gam /
analyzed: cha shas can zhes bya ba rdzas gcig bu zhig gam /
translated: What you assert as the objects of the eye and so on, such as blue and yellow, are they a single substance called a whole,

original: 'on te rdul phra rab ces bya ba du ma zhig ces kho bos de dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab ces bya ba du ma zhig ces kho bos de dpyad par bya'o //
translated: or are they many called subtle particles? I will investigate this.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas nyes pa ma mthong nas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas nyes pa ma mthong nas /
translated: The proponents of external objects, not seeing any fault, ask,

original: 'dis ci zhig bya zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig bya zhes dris te /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: de ltar ba yang ci nyes /
analyzed: de ltar ba yang ci nyes /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: bstan bcos byed pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas /
translated: The treatise states:

original: du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it is a plurality, etc.

original: du ma'i phyogs kyi nyes pa ni //
analyzed: du ma'i phyogs kyi nyes pa ni //
translated: The fault of being a plurality has been explained🔽In the section beginning:

original: phra rab rdul du du ma'ang min //
analyzed: phra rab rdul du du ma'ang min //
translated: The subtle particle does not exist as a plurality.

original: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it an aggregation,

original: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir //🔽zhes bya ba'i skabs der bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir // zhes bya ba'i skabs der bshad zin to //
translated: Because the subtle particle is not established.

original: gcig bu'i nyes pa'ang bshad pa nyid de yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig bu'i nyes pa'ang bshad pa nyid de yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The fault of being a unity has also been explained, and in order to demonstrate that, the treatise states:

original: gcig na rim gyis 'gro ba med //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gcig na rim gyis 'gro ba med // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it is one, there is no gradual movement.

original: sa la sogs pa cha shas gcig pu zhig yin du zin na srog @188b chags rnams rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa cha shas gcig pu zhig yin du zin na srog @188b chags rnams rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If earth and so on were a single part, living beings would not move gradually.

original: tshul rol gyi cha dang pha rol gyi tha dad pa gnyis zin pa dang ma zin pa cig car mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul rol gyi cha dang pha rol gyi tha dad pa gnyis zin pa dang ma zin pa cig car mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The simultaneous grasping and nongrasping of the two distinct parts, the near and the distant, would not occur.

original: gcig na 'dug pa'i glang po che la sogs pa du ma ris su chad par 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig na 'dug pa'i glang po che la sogs pa du ma ris su chad par 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The many distinct parts of an elephant and so on that are situated in one place would not occur.

original: srog chags phra mo rnams kyang blta bar mi snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: srog chags phra mo rnams kyang blta bar mi snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the summary extensively, the treatise states:

original: gal te mig gi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te mig gi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If the object of the eye, etc.

original: gal te mig gi yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ji snyed pa klung dang ngam grog la sogs pas ris su chad par 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te mig gi yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ji snyed pa klung dang ngam grog la sogs pas ris su chad par 'dod de /
translated: If one asserts that the objects of the eye, such as blue, yellow, etc., are divided by rivers, ravines, etc.,

original: de dag thams cad rdzas gcig par rtog na de'i tshe srog chags rnams rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rdzas gcig par rtog na de'i tshe srog chags rnams rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and conceives of them all as a single substance, then living beings would not move gradually.

original: ci'i phyir rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Why would they not move gradually?

original: de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: gom pa gcig bor bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gom pa gcig bor bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It states, Because in taking a single step...

original: ji ltar gom pa gcig bor bas bgrod par bya ba mtha' dag tu son pas gom pa dor bas gzhan gyis 'gro ci dgos te /
analyzed: ji ltar gom pa gcig bor bas bgrod par bya ba mtha' dag tu son pas gom pa dor bas gzhan gyis 'gro ci dgos te /
translated: Just as in taking a single step, one reaches the entire distance to be traversed, what need is there to take another step?

original: gang du rim gyis 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang du rim gyis 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: Where would there be gradual movement?

original: 'di ltar sa ni ris su ma chad de cha shas can rdzas su gcig pa cha shas med par 'dod pas de'i phyir rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa ni ris su ma chad de cha shas can rdzas su gcig pa cha shas med par 'dod pas de'i phyir rim gyis 'gro bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, space is not divided, and since it is asserted to be a single substance that has parts, it is not tenable that it moves gradually.

original: de ni 'di skad du gcig la yul gyi dngos por snga phyi tha dad pa ji ltar 'grub ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gcig la yul gyi dngos por snga phyi tha dad pa ji ltar 'grub ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is stated as follows: How could it be established that a single thing has earlier and later temporal differences?

original: 'di gnyis la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another fault in these two, he says:

original: tshul rol gyi cha zin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshul rol gyi cha zin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it were to apprehend the part of the side that is near,

original: gal te mig gi yul sngon po la sogs pa de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na de'i tshe rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gi tshu rol gyi cha zin la pha rol gyi cha ma zin pa cig car du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mig gi yul sngon po la sogs pa de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na de'i tshe rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gi tshu rol gyi cha zin la pha rol gyi cha ma zin pa cig car du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If all of those objects of the eye, such as blue and so on, were to be apprehended as one, then at that time the part of the side that is near would not be apprehended simultaneously with the part of the side that is far.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “At that time,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe dngos po gcig la zin pa dang ma zin pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe dngos po gcig la zin pa dang ma zin pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, at that time, it is not possible that a single thing is apprehended and not apprehended.

original: yang 'di nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'di nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Another fault is shown in the following:

original: glang po che dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: glang po che dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “If the elephant, etc.,

original: gal te ris su chad par snang ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na /
analyzed: gal te ris su chad par snang ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na /
translated: If all of these, which appear as discrete, were one,

original: de'i tshe gnas gcig gi steng na 'dug pa'i glang po che dang rta la sogs pa du ma ris su chad par 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas gcig gi steng na 'dug pa'i glang po che dang rta la sogs pa du ma ris su chad par 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then many elephants, horses, etc., standing in one place would not appear as discrete.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why?

original: gcig gang na 'dug pa zhes @189a * //
analyzed: gcig gang na 'dug pa zhes @189a * //
translated: “If the one were where the other is,

original: bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'di ltar glang po che gcig gang na 'dug pa de nyid na gzhan yang ba glang dang rta la sogs pa yang 'khod na ni de'i phyir de dag ris su chad par ji ltar rung /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar glang po che gcig gang na 'dug pa de nyid na gzhan yang ba glang dang rta la sogs pa yang 'khod na ni de'i phyir de dag ris su chad par ji ltar rung /
translated: etc.🔽Thus, if the elephant were where the other, the horse, etc., is, then how could they be discrete?

original: 'di ltar sa de ni rdzas gcig pa yin na gcig na gnas pa rnams yul tha dad pa na 'dug par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa de ni rdzas gcig pa yin na gcig na gnas pa rnams yul tha dad pa na 'dug par ga la 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could they be in different places, since that place would be one substance?

original: brgyal gzhan na nyes pa des 'jigs nas glang po che la sogs pa gnas phan tshun spangs te 'dug par rtog tu dogs nas /
analyzed: brgyal gzhan na nyes pa des 'jigs nas glang po che la sogs pa gnas phan tshun spangs te 'dug par rtog tu dogs nas /
translated: The other, fearing the fault of fainting, thinks that the elephant, etc., are mutually exclusive places and that they are not occupied.

original: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “Those two, etc.”

original: ji ste yul ris su chad par snang ba med na mi rung zhes gnas gcig gis /
analyzed: ji ste yul ris su chad par snang ba med na mi rung zhes gnas gcig gis /
translated: If it is not suitable for the appearance of the object to be divided into parts, then one place is not occupied.

original: spangs te / glang po che la sogs pa yul so so na 'khod de zhe na /
analyzed: spangs te / glang po che la sogs pa yul so so na 'khod de zhe na /
translated: The elephant, etc., are arranged in different places.

original: de lta na yang glang po dang rtas gang non pa dag gcig tu ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang glang po dang rtas gang non pa dag gcig tu ji ltar rung ste /
translated: Even so, how could it be suitable for the place that is trodden by the elephant and the horse to be one?

original: de gnyis kyis non pa gang yin pa dang / mnon pa gang yin pa de gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis non pa gang yin pa dang / mnon pa gang yin pa de gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The place that is trodden by those two and the place that is not trodden by those two would not be one. This is the meaning of the text.

original: gnyi gas gnyi gnon par brtag bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnyi gas gnyi gnon par brtag bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to imagine that both of them tread both.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: bar na de dag gis stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bar na de dag gis stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “In between, they are empty, etc.”

original: 'di ltar glang po che dang ba glang dang rta'i bar stong pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar glang po che dang ba glang dang rta'i bar stong pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the space between the elephant, cow, and horse appears.

original: gal te glang po che'i gor ba glang dang / rtas khyab par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te glang po che'i gor ba glang dang / rtas khyab par gyur la /
translated: If the space between the elephant and cow and horse were filled by the elephant,

original: ba glang dang rta'i gor yang glang po ches khyab na ni de'i bar yang de dag gis khyab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba glang dang rta'i gor yang glang po ches khyab na ni de'i bar yang de dag gis khyab par 'gyur te /
translated: and the space between the cow and horse were filled by the elephant, then the space between them would also be filled by them.

original: de bas na bar du yang de gnyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bar du yang de gnyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the two would also be apprehended in the space between them.

original: yang de nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de nyid la nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate another fault in that , he says:

original: chu'i skye bo phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chu'i skye bo phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The subtle creatures in water,” and so on.

original: gal te sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa mig gi yul ji snyed ba de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa mig gi yul ji snyed ba de dag thams cad gcig tu zin na /
translated: If all the objects of the eye, such as blue and yellow, were apprehended as one,

original: de'i tshe chu'i skye bo phra mo rnams kyang khang pa dang ril sogs pa chen po dag dang rang bzhin gcig pas mig gis mi sod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe chu'i skye bo phra mo rnams kyang khang pa dang ril sogs pa chen po dag dang rang bzhin gcig pas mig gis mi sod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the subtle creatures in water would not be imperceptible, because they would have the same nature as the large houses, mountains, and so on.

original: gcig pu rang bzhin tha dad ba med pa la mig gis sod pa dang mig gis mi sod pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: gcig pu rang bzhin tha dad ba med pa la mig gis sod pa dang mig gis mi sod pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the single nature is not different, but that the eye sees and the eye does not see.

original: gang gi tshe nyes pa 'di 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyes pa 'di 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: When one thinks that this fault arises,

original: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If you accept that things are different by reason of a difference in characteristics, etc.”

original: gal te dngos po rnams yul tha dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pas tha dad par mi 'dod kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa 'ba' zhig gis dngos po tha dad par khas len pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'di dag 'byung bar @189b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams yul tha dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pas tha dad par mi 'dod kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa 'ba' zhig gis dngos po tha dad par khas len pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'di dag 'byung bar @189b 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that things are different by reason of a difference in place, a difference in cause, and a difference in time, but accept that things are different only by reason of a difference in characteristics, then these faults will arise.

original: 'dir mtshan nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid dang sngon po la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid dang sngon po la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the characteristic is the object of the eye, etc., and blueness, etc.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin na go zhes bya ba la 'dis ni yul tha dad pa la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin na go zhes bya ba la 'dis ni yul tha dad pa la sogs pa ston to //
translated: If it is not elsewhere, this shows a difference in place, etc.

original: de'i phyir da ltar 'di la nyes pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar 'di la nyes pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, after showing the fault here, in order to conclude, he says,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig gi phyogs la nyes pa mang ba de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i yul sngon po la sogs pa nges par rdul phra rab tha dad par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig gi phyogs la nyes pa mang ba de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i yul sngon po la sogs pa nges par rdul phra rab tha dad par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Since there are many faults in the position of one, the object of the eye, etc., such as blue, must be investigated as different atoms.

original: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de ltar yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de ltar yod snyam pa la /
translated: How is it that there is no fault?

original: de'i phyir de gcig tu mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gcig tu mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is not established as one.

original: rdul phra rab de gcig tu mi 'grub po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de gcig tu mi 'grub po zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the atom is not established as one.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, it is this that is meant.

original: mig la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod bar 'grub ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod bar 'grub ste /
translated: The object of the eye, etc., such as form, etc., is established as existent.

original: kho bo la de tsam gyis chog gi rdul phra rab grub pas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: kho bo la de tsam gyis chog gi rdul phra rab grub pas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: We are satisfied with just that. What is the use of establishing the atom?

original: de'i phyir de mi 'grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi 'grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is not established, etc.

original: gal te rdul phra rab mi 'grub na gzugs la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab mi 'grub na gzugs la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa'i yul nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If the atom is not established, form, etc. are not established as the object of the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir yul med pa rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul med pa rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of objects is established as mere consciousness. This is the conclusion.

original: 'dir mdo sde pas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde pas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, the Sautrāntika raises an objection:

original: tshad ma'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
translated: “Due to the power of valid cognition,” and so on.

original: 'di ni yod do 'di ni med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i dbang gis dmigs kyis dbye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ni yod do 'di ni med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i dbang gis dmigs kyis dbye bar 'gyur la /
translated: “This exists, this does not exist” is distinguished by the power of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma thams cad kyi nang na yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad kyi nang na yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni mchog yin gyi /
translated: And among all valid cognitions, direct perception is supreme.🔽Thus, all doubts are eliminated by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis the tshom thams cad ldog ste 'di ni nye ba'i 'bras bu yang med na mngon sum mchog tu zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis the tshom thams cad ldog ste 'di ni nye ba'i 'bras bu yang med na mngon sum mchog tu zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: If it is supreme, what is the use of direct perception?

original: don de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don de med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If that object does not exist, and so on.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na de'i tshe gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum mo snyam du sems pa'i blo 'di ji ltar 'byang zhes sems pa'o //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na de'i tshe gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum mo snyam du sems pa'i blo 'di ji ltar 'byang zhes sems pa'o //
translated: If external objects do not exist, then how does this thought arise: “This form, sound, etc. is my direct perception?”

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa ltar gal te gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum gyis ma myong na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum mo zhes gzugs la sogs pa mthong ngo snyam du sems pa'i blo 'di ni ji ltar 'byung zhes bya ba de
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa ltar gal te gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum gyis ma myong na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum mo zhes gzugs la sogs pa mthong ngo snyam du sems pa'i blo 'di ni ji ltar 'byung zhes bya ba de
translated: If form, etc. is not experienced by direct perception, as the opponent believes, then how does this thought arise: “I see form, etc., this is my direct perception of form, etc.”?

original: de'i lan du bstan bcos byed pas /🔽mngon sum blo ni rmi sogs bzhin //
analyzed: de'i lan du bstan bcos byed pas / mngon sum blo ni rmi sogs bzhin //
translated: In response to this, the treatise states:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
translated: The mind of direct perception is like a dream, etc.

original: @190a * // dper na rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum ma snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin te /
