analyzed: @190a * // dper na rmi lam la sogs pa la don med par yang 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum ma snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin te /
translated: For example, even without an object, the thought arises in a dream, etc.: “This is my direct perception.”

original: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste /
translated: This consciousness itself arises appearing as an object.

original: don gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i skabs der sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: don gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i skabs der sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: “There is no object at all” is the same as what was taught earlier.

original: de nyid la yang gtan tshigs lhag par /
analyzed: de nyid la yang gtan tshigs lhag par /
translated: In that very [verse], the reason is stated in excess:

original: de yang gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de yang gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “And that also when . . .” and so on.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to fully liberate that very [reason],

original: gang gi tshe 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “When this . . .” and so on is stated.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum du mthong ba'i dngos po la sems pa de lta bu'i blo skad cig ma gsum pas 'byung ba de'i tshe khyod kyi don de mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ni bdag gi mngon sum du mthong ba'i dngos po la sems pa de lta bu'i blo skad cig ma gsum pas 'byung ba de'i tshe khyod kyi don de mi snang ngo //
translated: When this—the mind that thinks about the thing that is seen by my direct perception—arises with the third moment of mind, at that time your object does not appear.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Because the mental consciousness . . .” and so on is stated.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa des de ltar skad cig ma gsum pa la gang bcad pa dang / 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i tshe 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa des de ltar skad cig ma gsum pa la gang bcad pa dang / 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i tshe 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the mental consciousness that is the third moment of mind cuts off the eye consciousness in that way, and because the eye consciousness ceases at that time.

original: da bas na rtog pa'i dus na don de mngon sum du ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: da bas na rtog pa'i dus na don de mngon sum du ji ltar 'dod /
translated: Therefore, when the conceptual cognition occurs, how can it be maintained that the object is directly perceived?

original: de ni 'di skad du dbang po'i rnam par shes pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i tshe 'gag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du dbang po'i rnam par shes pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i tshe 'gag pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is what is being said: the eye consciousness sees form, etc., but it is non-conceptual and at that time it has ceased.

original: de ltar gzung ba mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba mi nus so //
translated: Thus, it cannot apprehend the object.

original: gang de ltar yongs su gcod pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang don de'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang de ltar yongs su gcod pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang don de'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin te /
translated: And the mental consciousness that determines the object in that way does not apprehend the intrinsic nature of that object.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe ji ltar don de mngon sum du 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe ji ltar don de mngon sum du 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, at that time, how can it be maintained that the object is directly perceived?

original: gal te don de dus gzhan na yang gnas pa /
analyzed: gal te don de dus gzhan na yang gnas pa /
translated: If the object exists at another time,

original: gal te phyis mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam du dgongs pa de la /
analyzed: gal te phyis mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam du dgongs pa de la /
translated: if it is thought that there is no error when the object is apprehended later by direct perception, then in response to that,

original: lhag par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lhag par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “it would be even more absurd,” and so on.

original: gal te don de dus gzhan na gnas na ni nyes pa 'di yang med na don de ni skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gal te don de dus gzhan na gnas na ni nyes pa 'di yang med na don de ni skad cig pa ste /
translated: If the object exists at another time, then this error would not occur. But that object is momentary.

original: de'i phyir skad cig par smra ba la don de shin tu mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig par smra ba la don de shin tu mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this fact is not directly evident to the proponents of momentariness.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa'i dus na de'i tshe gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni 'gags zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa'i dus na de'i tshe gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni 'gags zin to //
translated: Thus, when the conceptualization occurs, the form, taste, etc. have already ceased.

original: yang mdo sde pas gzhan du slar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang mdo sde pas gzhan du slar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: The Sautrantikas again raise an objection:

original: myong ba med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: myong ba med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Without experience, etc.

original: gang ma myong ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang ma myong ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran par mi 'gyur na /
translated: That which is not experienced is not remembered by the mental consciousness.

original: phyi rol sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran pa las de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i don gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran pa las de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i don gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the external, such as blue, yellow, etc. are remembered by the mental consciousness, therefore, the object, such as blue, etc. must be experienced.

original: @190b de ltar 'gyur du zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: @190b de ltar 'gyur du zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Even if that were so, what of it?

original: de ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The answer is: That is seeing, etc.

original: don gang myong ba de gzugs la sogs pa'i don mthong ba'o snyam du de ltar bsams nas mthong ba'i yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon du 'dod do //
analyzed: don gang myong ba de gzugs la sogs pa'i don mthong ba'o snyam du de ltar bsams nas mthong ba'i yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon du 'dod do //
translated: Having thought in this way, That which experiences the object is the seeing of the object such as form, one desires to see the object such as form that is present.

original: slob dpon gyis 'dir lan du myong ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'dir lan du myong ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The master responds here with, The meaning of the statement that which experiences the object and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i don dran pa yin no zhes bya ba de kho bo la ma grub bo //🔽ci'i phyir ma grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i don dran pa yin no zhes bya ba de kho bo la ma grub bo // ci'i phyir ma grub snyam pa la /
translated: The statement it is the memory of an object that is different from consciousness is not established for me.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Why is it not established? He says, In this way... and so on.

original: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very point,

original: dper na don med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na don med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, For example, without an object... and so on.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol na med par yang gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa byung ba de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol na med par yang gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa byung ba de bzhin te /
translated: For example, even though form and so on do not exist externally, the cognition of eye consciousness and so on arises as the appearance of an object such as form.

original: kho bos rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: kho bos rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don du snang bar 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, this very consciousness arises as the appearance of an object.

original: don gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
analyzed: don gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained in the above.

original: de ltar gyur du zin kyang skabs 'dir ci zhig 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur du zin kyang skabs 'dir ci zhig 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: Even if that were so, what is accomplished in this context?

original: de'i phyir / de las dran par zad ces bya ba smos so //🔽de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las dran par zad ces bya ba smos so // de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “It is just memory of that. ”🔽In order to explain that, it is said:

original: rnam par rig pa de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “From that consciousness, etc. ”

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de las rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyis rnam par rig pa dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de las rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyis rnam par rig pa dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'byung ste /
translated: From that consciousness that appears as form, etc. , the conceptual mind consciousness arises, associated with memory.

original: dran pa 'byung ba de las gzhan myong ba mi 'grub pa //
analyzed: dran pa 'byung ba de las gzhan myong ba mi 'grub pa //
translated: From the arising of memory, the establishment of experience is not accomplished.

original: de ni 'di skad du myong ba ni dran pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du myong ba ni dran pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: This is what is being said: Experience is the cause of memory.

original: myong ba ni bdag cag la yod do //
analyzed: myong ba ni bdag cag la yod do //
translated: We do have experience.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that appears as an object such as form.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa myong ba nyid la dran pa 'byung gi / don gung na yod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa myong ba nyid la dran pa 'byung gi / don gung na yod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, memory occurs in relation to the experience of consciousness that appears as the object, such as form, etc. What need is there for an external object?

original: yang mdo sde pas gzhan du brgal ba'i phyir /🔽dper na rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang mdo sde pas gzhan du brgal ba'i phyir / dper na rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Again, the Sautrantikas argue as follows:🔽For example, all consciousnesses in a dream🔽occur without any object.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi don med par 'byung ba de bzhin du gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang 'gyur na ni /🔽de'i tshe dper na rmi lam na dmigs pa'i don ni med par 'jig rten rang gis khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi don med par 'byung ba de bzhin du gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang 'gyur na ni / de'i tshe dper na rmi lam na dmigs pa'i don ni med par 'jig rten rang gis khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
translated: If, in the same way, they also occurred without an object when one is not asleep,🔽then, just as the world understands that the object perceived in a dream does not exist,

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa na dmigs pa'i don med par 'jig rten @191a * //
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa na dmigs pa'i don med par 'jig rten @191a * //
translated: in the same way, the world would also understand that the object perceived when not asleep does not exist.

original: rang gis khong du chud pa'i rigs na khong du ma chud de de'i phyir rmi lam bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i blo thams cad don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis khong du chud pa'i rigs na khong du ma chud de de'i phyir rmi lam bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i blo thams cad don med pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were the case that one understood that, one would not understand that. Therefore, all cognitions that occur when one is not awakened from sleep, like in a dream, are not meaningless.

original: 'dir bstan bcos byed pas /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos byed pas /
translated: Here, the author of the treatise states:

original: de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “That is not a valid reason.”

original: 'di ni rmi lam dang mi 'dra ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ni rmi lam dang mi 'dra ba med de /
translated: This is not different from a dream.

original: 'di ltar ji srid dus dpar ma gyur pa de srid du rmi lam gyi blo yang yul med par khod du chud par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid dus dpar ma gyur pa de srid du rmi lam gyi blo yang yul med par khod du chud par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, as long as one has not awakened from a dream, one does not understand that the cognition in a dream lacks an object.

original: nam sad bar gyur ba de na khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nam sad bar gyur ba de na khong du chud pa de bzhin du /
translated: When one awakens, one understands that.

original: gnyid kyi sam log pa'i dus 'di na yang log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi gnyid kyis log pa'i 'jig rten ni rmi lam bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyid kyi sam log pa'i dus 'di na yang log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi gnyid kyis log pa'i 'jig rten ni rmi lam bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ste /
translated: In the same way, in this world, which is asleep due to the sleep of the latent propensities of habituation to false imagination, one sees unreal objects, like in a dream.

original: ji srid du ma sad pa de srid du gnyid kyis ma log pa na dmigs pa'i don de med par khong du ma chud do //
analyzed: ji srid du ma sad pa de srid du gnyid kyis ma log pa na dmigs pa'i don de med par khong du ma chud do //
translated: As long as one is not awakened, as long as one is not free from sleep, one does not understand that the object of perception does not exist.

original: de ni log pa yang yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: de ni log pa yang yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
translated: The compound mithyāvikalpa is resolved as follows: it is mithyā, false, and it is vikalpa, discursive thought.

original: de la goms pa ni log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa ste /
analyzed: de la goms pa ni log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa ste /
translated: Cultivation of that is the cultivation of false discursive thought.

original: yang dang yang mngon du gyur pa ni goms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang mngon du gyur pa ni goms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Repeated manifestation is called cultivation.

original: log par rnam par rtog pa de las byung ba'i bag chags gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: log par rnam par rtog pa de las byung ba'i bag chags gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The latent impressions that arise from that false discursive thought are called that.

original: gnyid dang 'dra ba'i bag chags rnam pa de lta bu de la gnyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid dang 'dra ba'i bag chags rnam pa de lta bu de la gnyid ces bya'o //
translated: That latent impression, which is like sleep, is called sleep.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ma nor bar khong du mi chung ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ma nor bar khong du mi chung ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not as it really is means not understood without error.

original: nam zhig de med par khong du chud par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: nam zhig de med par khong du chud par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: When will that be understood to be nonexistent?

original: gang gi tshe de'i gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: When its antidote arises, etc.

original: gang gi tshe bag chags de'i gnyen bor gyur pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas sad par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mngon du 'gyur ro
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags de'i gnyen bor gyur pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas sad par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mngon du 'gyur ro
translated: When one has attained the supramundane nonconceptual wisdom that is the antidote to that habitual tendency and has awakened from it, then the supramundane post equipoise pure mundane wisdom manifests.

original: // de mngon sum du gyur nas yul med pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud de /
analyzed: // de mngon sum du gyur nas yul med pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud de /
translated: When that manifests, one comprehends the absence of objects as it is.

original: de ni 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa byis pa'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa byis pa'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: This is stated as follows: The forms and so on imputed by childish beings are not objects of the supramundane wisdom.

original: gang dag de'i yul gyi dngos por ma gyur pa de dag gi rtog pa'i shes pa dag pa 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba rnams kyis sel to //
analyzed: gang dag de'i yul gyi dngos por ma gyur pa de dag gi rtog pa'i shes pa dag pa 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba rnams kyis sel to //
translated: Those that are not objects of that are eliminated by the pure mundane wisdoms that are conceptual consciousnesses.

original: de bas na de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de ni mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore it is similar.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i @191b ye shes thob ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang mi mthun pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i @191b ye shes thob ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang mi mthun pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The attainment of supramundane, nonconceptual intuition is the attainment of the supramundane, since it is not common to the mundane.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is free from the concepts of subject and object.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur zhes bya ba na de'i rjes las thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur zhes bya ba na de'i rjes las thob pa ste /
translated: The actualization of the pure mundane intuition that is attained subsequently to that is the actualization of the pure mundane intuition that is attained subsequently to that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “that” refers to the supramundane intuition.

original: rjes zhes bya ba ni stobs la bya'o //
analyzed: rjes zhes bya ba ni stobs la bya'o //
translated: The word “subsequently” refers to the powers.

original: de ni de'i rjes las thob pa yang yin la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i rjes las thob pa yang yin la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
translated: It is both attained subsequently to that and pure mundane intuition.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is free from the instinct for the concept of subject and object.

original: mngon par zhen pa med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: It is mundane because the appearance of subject and object occurs even though there is no longer any adherence to them.

original: 'dir de'i spyi'i don ni spros pa'i bag chags nang na gnas pa yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don snang pa'i shes pa rnams 'khor ba'i gnas su 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir de'i spyi'i don ni spros pa'i bag chags nang na gnas pa yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don snang pa'i shes pa rnams 'khor ba'i gnas su 'jug ste /
translated: Here, the general meaning is that consciousnesses that appear as objects such as form enter the state of cyclic existence through the power of the complete maturation of the latent propensities for conceptualization that reside within.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis bag chags de dag spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes byung nas yul med par rtogs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis bag chags de dag spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes byung nas yul med par rtogs so //
translated: When transcendent wisdom abandons those latent propensities, then pure mundane wisdom arises and realizes the nonexistence of objects.

original: gang mdo sde pas slar brgal ba'i phyir /🔽gal te rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang mdo sde pas slar brgal ba'i phyir / gal te rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to the Sautrāntika objection, Vasubandhu says,🔽If it is due to the special transformation of the latent propensities that exist in one’s own mind stream,

original: gal te rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i bag chags gyur pa'i khyad par gyi srog chags rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par las ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i bag chags gyur pa'i khyad par gyi srog chags rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par las ma yin na /
translated: if the consciousness that appears as objects such as form arises due to the special transformation of the latent propensities that exist in one’s own mind stream and not due to special objects such as form,

original: de'i tshe gang gis sdig pa'i grogs po la brten pa las sems can rnams kyi lus kyi bya ba mi dge ba'i rnam par rig ba nges pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa las lus kyi bya ba dge ba'i rnam par rig pa nges pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gis sdig pa'i grogs po la brten pa las sems can rnams kyi lus kyi bya ba mi dge ba'i rnam par rig ba nges pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa las lus kyi bya ba dge ba'i rnam par rig pa nges pa dang /
translated: At that time, the body actions of sentient beings are ascertained as the negative actions that arise from relying on bad friends, and the virtuous body actions that arise from relying on spiritual friends.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyan pas ngag gi bya ba sdig pa las log pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa nges pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa las sems can rnams kyi dbang gi bya ba sdig pa la 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa nges par sdig pa'i grogs po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyan pas ngag gi bya ba sdig pa las log pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa nges pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa las sems can rnams kyi dbang gi bya ba sdig pa la 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa nges par sdig pa'i grogs po dang /
translated: Similarly, the speech actions of sentient beings are ascertained as the verbal actions that turn away from negative actions through listening to the holy Dharma, and the verbal actions that engage in negative actions through listening to non-Dharma.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa med la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa med la /
translated: Without relying on bad friends and spiritual friends,

original: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa med na ji ltar 'grub par brjod de /
analyzed: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa med na ji ltar 'grub par brjod de /
translated: and without the teachings of the holy and the unholy, how can they be accomplished?

original: de ni 'di skad du ji tsam du sdig pa'i grogs po dang dge ba'i bshes @192a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ji tsam du sdig pa'i grogs po dang dge ba'i bshes @192a * //
translated: This is stated as follows: To the extent that one relies on bad friends and spiritual friends,

original: gnyen spyod pa mi dmigs pa de tsam du de'i rjes su byed mi nus so //
analyzed: gnyen spyod pa mi dmigs pa de tsam du de'i rjes su byed mi nus so //
translated: One cannot follow it to that extent, to the non-apprehension of sexual union.

original: ji tsam du sgra'i rang bzhin dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pa med pa de tsam du de dang mthun par sgrub cing byed mi nus so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du sgra'i rang bzhin dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pa med pa de tsam du de dang mthun par sgrub cing byed mi nus so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that there is no hearing of the nature of sound, whether of good or bad dharmas, to that extent one cannot practice and act in accordance with it.

original: bstan bcos byed pas de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The treatise-writer states this in order to remove that doubt:

original: gcig la gcig gi dbang gis na //
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi dbang gis na //
translated: “By the power of each other”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very point, he says:

original: sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “of all sentient beings” and so on.

original: 'di ltar srog chags thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa phan tshun gyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'byung ba nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog chags thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa phan tshun gyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'byung ba nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the consciousnesses of all living beings are definitely produced from each other by the power of each other.

original: ci rigs su sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi spyod pa la slob par 'dod pa'i dbang gis de dang mthun par byed pa rnams kyi sdig pa dang / dge ba'i lus kyi las kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi / phyi rol na lus kyi las dang lus ni med do //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi spyod pa la slob par 'dod pa'i dbang gis de dang mthun par byed pa rnams kyi sdig pa dang / dge ba'i lus kyi las kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi / phyi rol na lus kyi las dang lus ni med do //
translated: “In whatever way” means that the representations of sinful and virtuous bodily actions arise in those who wish to learn the conduct of sinful friends and spiritual teachers, respectively, and who act accordingly. But external bodily actions and bodies do not exist.

original: de bzhin du dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos smra bar 'dod pa'i dbang gis nyan pa rnams kyi dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi / phyi rol na sgra ni med de 'di la ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos smra bar 'dod pa'i dbang gis nyan pa rnams kyi dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung gi / phyi rol na sgra ni med de 'di la ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin no //
translated: Similarly, the representations of the teachings of the holy and the unholy arise in the listeners who wish to hear the teachings of the holy and the unholy, respectively, but external sounds do not exist. This is the meaning of “in whatever way.”

original: gcig la gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ma grags pas de bas na de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig la gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ma grags pas de bas na de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the term “mutually” is not well known, he says,

original: gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “mutually” and so on.

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since this is easy to understand, I will not comment on it.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brgal ba'i lan btab nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brgal ba'i lan btab nas /
translated: Therefore, having responded to that objection in that way,

original: srog chags kyi tha snyad thams cad rnam par rig pa rnams kyis phan tshun gyi dbang gis 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog chags kyi tha snyad thams cad rnam par rig pa rnams kyis phan tshun gyi dbang gis 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that all conventions of living beings arise through the power of reciprocal cognitions,

original: rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽srog chags dang 'brel ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni rgyud gzhan gyi 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i khyad par las rgyud gzhan la 'gro ba dang smra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i khyad par 'byung gi phyi rol gyi don gyi khyad par lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid las ni
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // srog chags dang 'brel ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni rgyud gzhan gyi 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i khyad par las rgyud gzhan la 'gro ba dang smra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i khyad par 'byung gi phyi rol gyi don gyi khyad par lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid las ni
translated: he says, “The difference in cognitions of other continua,” and so on.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: All conventions related to living beings arise from the difference in cognitions of other continua, such as the desire to go and the desire to speak, and so on. The difference in cognitions of going and speaking and so on arises in other continua, but not from the difference in external objects characterized by the conventions of body and speech.

original: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, because the proponent of external objects objects,

original: dper na rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “For example, in a dream,” and so on.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par rig pa'i don med par 'dod @192b pa de bzhin du gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i yang don med par 'dod na /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi rnam par rig pa'i don med par 'dod @192b pa de bzhin du gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i yang don med par 'dod na /
translated: For example, just as you assert that the object of consciousness in a dream is nonexistent, so too, if you assert that the object of consciousness when not asleep is nonexistent,

original: gnyid kyis log pa dang ma log pa na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba kun du spyad pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma la 'dod par 'dra bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa dang ma log pa na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba kun du spyad pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma la 'dod par 'dra bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: then why would you not equally assert that the result of the practice of virtue, such as generosity, in both states, when asleep and when not asleep, is desired in a future life?

original: gnyid kyis log pa dang gnyid kyis ma log pa na srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i 'bras bu yang phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'dra bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa dang gnyid kyis ma log pa na srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i 'bras bu yang phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'dra bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: And why would you not equally assert that the result of the practice of nonvirtue, such as killing, in both states, when asleep and when not asleep, is not desired in a future life?

original: gnyi ga yang don med par mtshungs na go snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang don med par mtshungs na go snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: If both are equally nonexistent, why do you think that?

original: bstan bcos byed pas de'i lan du sems ni gnyid kyis non pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas de'i lan du sems ni gnyid kyis non pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the author of the treatise states, “The mind is overcome by sleep.”

original: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na ni dge ba'am mi dge ba dag gnyid kyis non pa'i sems kyis kyang byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na ni dge ba'am mi dge ba dag gnyid kyis non pa'i sems kyis kyang byed de /
translated: Thus, in the dream state, virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are performed by the mind that is overcome by sleep.

original: de'i phyir gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na byed pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rmi lam gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na byed pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rmi lam gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions performed when one is not asleep are not the same as the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions performed in a dream.

original: gang gnyid kyis non pa de ni 'dir 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i rgyu yin gyi don yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gnyid kyis non pa de ni 'dir 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i rgyu yin gyi don yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the difference in results is the fact that one is overcome by sleep. It is not that the object does not exist.

original: 'di ltar sad pa'i dus na g-yengs pa dang 'dres par rnam par rtog pa ngan pas dge ba'i 'bras bu yang chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa'i dus na g-yengs pa dang 'dres par rnam par rtog pa ngan pas dge ba'i 'bras bu yang chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when one is awake, the results of virtuous actions are diminished by the presence of bad thoughts that are distracted and confused.

original: de bas na rmi lam gyi gnod pa yang 'bras bu chung du'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rmi lam gyi gnod pa yang 'bras bu chung du'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the results of harm done in a dream are also diminished.

original: yang 'di ni 'bras bu mi mtshungs pa'i rgyu gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di ni 'bras bu mi mtshungs pa'i rgyu gzhan yin te /
translated: There is another cause of the difference in results.

original: rmi lam na sbyin pa ni len pa po su yang med /
analyzed: rmi lam na sbyin pa ni len pa po su yang med /
translated: In a dream, there is no recipient of a gift.

original: su la yang phan 'dogs pa med do //
analyzed: su la yang phan 'dogs pa med do //
translated: There is no one who is benefited.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam na gsad par bya ba yang su yang med yang dag pa'i don du su la yang gnod par byed pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam na gsad par bya ba yang su yang med yang dag pa'i don du su la yang gnod par byed pa med do //
translated: Likewise, in a dream, there is no one to be killed, and in reality, no one is harmed.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni srog chags dag kyang yod la ;
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni srog chags dag kyang yod la ;
translated: When one is not asleep, there are living beings,

original: gang dag la sbyin par 'dod pa'i dbang gis len par snang ba 'byung zhing rim gyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur bas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag la sbyin par 'dod pa'i dbang gis len par snang ba 'byung zhing rim gyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur bas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and those who appear to be recipients of gifts, due to the power of one’s desire to give, arise, and one benefits them, since they experience pleasure in sequence.

original: gang dag la gsad par 'dod pa'i dbang gis mtshon gyi rnam pa'i shes pa rig pas mi bzod pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba na 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag la gsad par 'dod pa'i dbang gis mtshon gyi rnam pa'i shes pa rig pas mi bzod pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba na 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those who are to be killed arise, due to the power of one’s desire to kill, and one experiences the feeling of intolerance of the cognition of the form of a weapon, one harms them, since one experiences the characteristics of death.

original: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas slar brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, the proponent of external objects objects:

original: gal te 'di dag rnam par rig pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rnam par rig pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If these are mere representations, then why do we not cognize all objects as we do our own representations?

original: gal te 'gro ba 'dis mtha' dag rnam par rig pa tsam du zad na sems can gang la yang lus med la ngag kyang med de /🔽de'i phyir @193a * //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba 'dis mtha' dag rnam par rig pa tsam du zad na sems can gang la yang lus med la ngag kyang med de / de'i phyir @193a * //
translated: If all this world is merely consciousness, then no sentient being has a body or speech.

original: shan pa la sogs pas gsod pa na lug la sogs pa 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur /🔽gal te shan pa la sogs pa la lus dang ngag yod la lug rnams kyi lus kyang yod na de'i tshe de dag gis de dag rang gi lug lag dar te gsod pa'am /
analyzed: shan pa la sogs pas gsod pa na lug la sogs pa 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur / gal te shan pa la sogs pa la lus dang ngag yod la lug rnams kyi lus kyang yod na de'i tshe de dag gis de dag rang gi lug lag dar te gsod pa'am /
translated: How then can sheep and so on die when slaughtered by butchers and so on?

original: gzhan la sod ces tshig gis bsgo bas lug rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la sod ces tshig gis bsgo bas lug rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If butchers and so on have bodies and speech and the sheep have bodies, then they would kill the sheep with their own hands or order others to kill them with their own speech.🔽How could the sheep die merely by the butchers’ intention to kill?

original: lus dang ngag med na gsad par bsams pa tsam gyis gzhan dag 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur te de ltar 'dod na ni gang zag 'ga' zhig khos te gnod par bya ba'i sems bskyed ba de nyid kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag med na gsad par bsams pa tsam gyis gzhan dag 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur te de ltar 'dod na ni gang zag 'ga' zhig khos te gnod par bya ba'i sems bskyed ba de nyid kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that, then some people would die merely by generating the thought to kill and harm them.

original: ji ste nyes pa 'di dag 'byung du 'ong zhes de dag 'chi ba des byas par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe lug 'chi ba shan pa rnams kyis ma bsad pas /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'di dag 'byung du 'ong zhes de dag 'chi ba des byas par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe lug 'chi ba shan pa rnams kyis ma bsad pas /
translated: If you do not accept that the death of the sheep is caused by the butcher, because you think that these faults would ensue, then how could the butcher, etc.,

original: shan pa la sogs pa srog gcod pa'i kha na ma thob dang ji ltar ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: shan pa la sogs pa srog gcod pa'i kha na ma thob dang ji ltar ldan par 'gyur /
translated: come to possess the sin of killing?

original: bstan bcos byed pas de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that, the author of the treatise says:

original: 'chi ba gzhan gyi rnam rig gis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'chi ba gzhan gyi rnam rig gis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Death is not caused by the consciousness of another.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say that the consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.

original: rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gang gis mtshon gdab par gzas pas phyi rol gyi don du smra bas gzhan gsod par byed do //🔽de bas na rnam par rig pa'i bye brag mtshon cha med pa las gzhan 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gang gis mtshon gdab par gzas pas phyi rol gyi don du smra bas gzhan gsod par byed do // de bas na rnam par rig pa'i bye brag mtshon cha med pa las gzhan 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.

original: dper na 'dre la sogs pa'i yid kyi dbang gis sems can gzhan dag gi dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na 'dre la sogs pa'i yid kyi dbang gis sems can gzhan dag gi dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal power of causing forgetfulness.🔽The consciousness of another can kill, because it is like the supernormal

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdor byas pa'i don de rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively explain the meaning of the Compendium of Abhidharma,

original: dper na 'brel sogs pa'i yid kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na 'brel sogs pa'i yid kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, for example, through the power of the mind such as the mind of a ghost and so on.

original: dper na 'dre la sogs pa'i ngan sems kyi sems kyi dbang gis srog chags gzhan dag gi dran pa nyams par 'gyur ba dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi gnod pa'i sems kyi dbang gis gzhan dag gi snying gi khrag 'byin pa dang / de bzhin du lha'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rmi ltas su mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dper na 'dre la sogs pa'i ngan sems kyi sems kyi dbang gis srog chags gzhan dag gi dran pa nyams par 'gyur ba dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi gnod pa'i sems kyi dbang gis gzhan dag gi snying gi khrag 'byin pa dang / de bzhin du lha'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rmi ltas su mthong ba dang /
translated: For example, through the power of the mind of an evil spirit and so on, the memory of other living beings is impaired, through the power of the mind of harm of the ḍākinīs, the blood of others' hearts is drawn out, and through the power of the mind of a god, one sees omens in dreams.

original: de bzhin du sngags mkhan gyi yid kyi dbang gis 'byung po'i gdon pham par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' lding gi sngags byed pa'i yid kyi dbang gis dug sel zhing 'pho ba la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i yid kyi dbang gis gzhan dag gi 'gyur ba rnam pa mang po 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags mkhan gyi yid kyi dbang gis 'byung po'i gdon pham par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' lding gi sngags byed pa'i yid kyi dbang gis dug sel zhing 'pho ba la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i yid kyi dbang gis gzhan dag gi 'gyur ba rnam pa mang po 'byung ba dang /
translated: Likewise, the mental power of a mantra practitioner can defeat the demons of spirits. Likewise, the mental power of one who recites the mantra of Garuḍa can remove poison and transfer it to others. Likewise, the mental power of one with magical power can cause many changes in others.

original: dper na k'a tya'i bu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sa ra nas rmi ltas su mthong ba dang / dper na drang srong dgon pa pa rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa lham yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris pham zhes grags pa de bzhin du shan pa la sogs pa'i @193b gnod sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis lug la sogs pa gzhan dag
analyzed: dper na k'a tya'i bu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sa ra nas rmi ltas su mthong ba dang / dper na drang srong dgon pa pa rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa lham yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris pham zhes grags pa de bzhin du shan pa la sogs pa'i @193b gnod sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis lug la sogs pa gzhan dag
translated: For example, through the blessing of Mahākātyāyana, Saraṇa saw a dream omen. For example, through the disturbance of the minds of the ṛṣis of the forest, the mind of the demon king Rāvaṇa was disturbed, and he was defeated. Likewise, through the specific consciousnesses of butchers and so on, other sheep and so on are killed.

original: gi srog gi dbang po dang mi mthun pa'i 'gyur ba rnam pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: gi srog gi dbang po dang mi mthun pa'i 'gyur ba rnam pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung ste /
translated: Such changes occur that are incompatible with the life faculty.

original: de byung bas ris gcig pa skal ba 'dra bas bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud kyi rgyun 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byung bas ris gcig pa skal ba 'dra bas bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud kyi rgyun 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, the continuum of mind and mental factors that is included in the same type and similar lot is interrupted. That is death.

original: de lta na gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis gzhan dag 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis gzhan dag 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In that way, the death of others should be understood by the specific awareness of others.

original: de ltar rigs pas don bstan kyang brgyal gzhan dag khas mi len kyang srid pas de'i phyir /🔽drang srong khros pas dan ta ka'i //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas don bstan kyang brgyal gzhan dag khas mi len kyang srid pas de'i phyir / drang srong khros pas dan ta ka'i //
translated: In that way, although the meaning is taught by reasoning, it is possible that others do not accept it, so it is said:🔽“How did the sage’s anger

original: dgon pa ji ltar stongs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dgon pa ji ltar stongs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Empty the forest of Tāta?”

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said:

original: gal te gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “If by the specific awareness of others…” and so on.

original: gal te gsod pa po rnams kyis gsod pa'i bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis sems can gsad par bya ba dag 'chi bar khyod mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gsod pa po rnams kyis gsod pa'i bsam pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis sems can gsad par bya ba dag 'chi bar khyod mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that living beings to be killed die through the specific consciousness of the killer’s intention to kill,

original: de'i tshe yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bzhed nas /
translated: then you must accept that the mental fault of a great offense is established.

original: bde bar gshegs pa thub pas khyim bdag nye ba 'khor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa thub pas khyim bdag nye ba 'khor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Sugata, the Sage, said to the householder Upali:

original: khyod kyis dan ta ka'i dgon pa la sogs pa de dag gna' sngon mi brgya phrag du mas gang ba'i ljongs su gyur pa zhes grags na de ji ltar skad cig tu dgon par gyur te stongs pa dang gtsang mar gyur pa ci thos zhes de skad ces
analyzed: khyod kyis dan ta ka'i dgon pa la sogs pa de dag gna' sngon mi brgya phrag du mas gang ba'i ljongs su gyur pa zhes grags na de ji ltar skad cig tu dgon par gyur te stongs pa dang gtsang mar gyur pa ci thos zhes de skad ces
translated: “You have heard that in the past, the forest of Dantaloka and so on were inhabited by hundreds of thousands of people. How did they become empty and desolate in an instant? What did you hear about how they became pure?”

original: bka' stsal pa dang / des drang srong rnams khros pa de dag de ltar gyur ces bdag gis thos so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa dang / des drang srong rnams khros pa de dag de ltar gyur ces bdag gis thos so zhes gsol to //
translated: He said, “I heard that the sages became angry and that is what happened.”

original: de yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis de snyed cig 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis de snyed cig 'chi bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that many die just from the disturbance of their minds?

original: de ni 'di skad du gal te gsod pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis gsad par bya ba rnams 'chi bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te gsod pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bye brag gis gsad par bya ba rnams 'chi bar mi 'dod na /
translated: This is what is being taught: If those who are to be killed do not die by the specific consciousness of the killer,

original: de'i tshe drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis sems can de snyed cig 'chi ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis sems can de snyed cig 'chi ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur /
translated: then it is not reasonable that so many beings die just by the disturbance of the sages’ minds.

original: yid kyi nyes pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nyes pa spyad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nyes pa spyad pa la bya'o //
translated: “Mental fault” refers to the practice of mental fault.

original: dan ta ka'i dgon pa dang / ma ta ga'i dgon pa dang / ka lim ka'i dgon pa zhes bya ba de dag ni dgon pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dan ta ka'i dgon pa dang / ma ta ga'i dgon pa dang / ka lim ka'i dgon pa zhes bya ba de dag ni dgon pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The “forest of Danda,” the “forest of Mata,” and the “forest of Kalika” are the names of forests.

original: stongs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stongs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Deserted” means “uninhabited.”

original: gtsang mar gyur ces bya ba ni skye bo med na bshad gci med pa'i phyir gtsang mar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtsang mar gyur ces bya ba ni skye bo med na bshad gci med pa'i phyir gtsang mar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Pure” means “clean,” because in the absence of people, there is no excrement.

original: brgya la gzhan dag drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs par shes bzhin du mi ma yin pa skabs tshol ba dag gis gsad do zhes zer du dogs nas /🔽yid nyes kha na ma tho cher //
analyzed: brgya la gzhan dag drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs par shes bzhin du mi ma yin pa skabs tshol ba dag gis gsad do zhes zer du dogs nas / yid nyes kha na ma tho cher //
translated: If someone else were to say, I fear that the non-human beings will kill the sages, knowing that their minds are disturbed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he would say, The mental fault is a great offense, and so on.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify that very point, he says,

original: gal te 'di ltar rtog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽gal te mi ma yin pa gang dag @194a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar rtog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te mi ma yin pa gang dag @194a * //
translated: If you think like this, and so on.

original: drang srong rnams la dga'/🔽de dag gi lus dang ngag gi yul de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kha btag gi / drang srong de dag gi yid 'khrugs bas dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes de'i tshe mi ma yin pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag gi las de lus dang ngag
analyzed: drang srong rnams la dga'/ de dag gi lus dang ngag gi yul de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kha btag gi / drang srong de dag gi yid 'khrugs bas dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes de'i tshe mi ma yin pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag gi las de lus dang ngag
translated: If the non-human beings who delight in the sages🔽harm the bodies and speech of those beings who dwell there,🔽it is not because of the disturbance of the minds of those sages.

original: gi nyes pa rnams pas yid kyi nyes pa ches kha na mtho ba chen po dang bcas par grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gi nyes pa rnams pas yid kyi nyes pa ches kha na mtho ba chen po dang bcas par grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: At that time, the mental fault of the non-human beings is established as a greater offense than the physical and verbal faults of the body and speech.🔽How is that so?

original: gang gi tshe kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas par grub ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas par grub ce na /
translated: When is it established that it has a great offense?

original: de'i yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i yid 'khrugs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “merely by the disturbance of his mind, etc.”

original: gang gi tshe lus dang ngag gi spyod pa med par drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa tsam 'ba' zhig gis sems can de snyed 'chi bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus dang ngag gi spyod pa med par drang srong rnams kyi yid 'khrugs pa tsam 'ba' zhig gis sems can de snyed 'chi bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that many sentient beings die merely by the disturbance of the mind of the sages, without the activity of body and speech,

original: yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma thob chen po dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo /
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma thob chen po dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo /
translated: then it is established that mental wrongdoing has a great offense.

original: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas brgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phyi rol gyi don du smra bas brgal ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, because of the objection of the proponents of external objects,

original: gal te 'di dag rnam par shes pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rnam par shes pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If these are mere consciousness, etc.”

original: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig kho nar zad na de'i tshe ;
analyzed: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig kho nar zad na de'i tshe ;
translated: If it is merely mind and mental factors free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: then the yogi who has attained knowledge of the minds of others

original: ci gzhan gyi sems shes sam /
analyzed: ci gzhan gyi sems shes sam /
translated: knows the minds of others,

original: 'on te mi shes smros shig / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gnyi gar nyes par ma mthong nas /
analyzed: 'on te mi shes smros shig / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gnyi gar nyes par ma mthong nas /
translated: The proponent of tenets, not seeing a fault in either, asks,

original: 'dis ci zhig bya zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig bya zhes dris te /
translated: “What is the point of this?”

original: de ni go sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bsam bshad do //
translated: That is easy to understand, so I will not explain it.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas gnyi ga yang nyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas gnyi ga yang nyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The proponents of external objects say that both are faulty.

original: gal te mi shes na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te mi shes na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, “If you do not know,” and so on.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pas gzhan dag gi sems mi shes na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rig pa zhes kyang ji skad du bya /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pas gzhan dag gi sems mi shes na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rig pa zhes kyang ji skad du bya /
translated: If the yogi does not know the minds of others, then at that time how could it be said that he knows the minds of others?

original: 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi sems rig pa de la 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi sems rig pa de la 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: In this way, it is said that one who knows the minds of others🔽is called a mind reader.

original: sgra 'di'i rgyu ni bya ba de med na bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra 'di'i rgyu ni bya ba de med na bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could this term be used if the cause of this term did not exist?

original: ji ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes te gzhan gyi sems shes par khas len na /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes te gzhan gyi sems shes par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that you know the minds of others because you fear that this fault will arise,

original: de'i tshe de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since the appearance of apprehended and apprehender would occur, it would not be an accurate object of knowledge.

original: bsgom pa shin tu mthar phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bsgom pa shin tu mthar phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the consciousness of yogins who have perfected meditation not be in accordance with fact?

original: de ni 'di skad du gal te gzhan gyi sems shes na de'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par khas blangs pas rnam par reg pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gal te gzhan gyi sems shes na de'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par khas blangs pas rnam par reg pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: if it knows the mind of another, then since it is accepted that it has the aspect of the object and subject, it would be contact.

original: don mi shes na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rig pa yod do zhes ma zer cig ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mi shes na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rig pa yod do zhes ma zer cig ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not know the object, then at that time do not say that it knows the mind of another.

original: bstan bcos byed pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de khas blangs nas de na ji lta ba bzhin ma yin @194b pa'i dpe bstan pa /🔽dper na rang sems shes pa can //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de khas blangs nas de na ji lta ba bzhin ma yin @194b pa'i dpe bstan pa / dper na rang sems shes pa can //
translated: The treatise author accepts that it is not in accordance with fact and teaches an example of what is not in accordance with fact:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For example, it is like knowing one’s own mind.

original: dper na srog chags rnams kyi rang gi sems 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na srog chags rnams kyi rang gi sems 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa shes pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: For example, the knowledge of one’s own past and future mind of living beings is not in accordance with fact.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the knowledge of the minds of others by yogins is not in accordance with fact.

original: gzhan gyi sems rig pa zhes brjod pa ni rtogs so snyam pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rig pa zhes brjod pa ni rtogs so snyam pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression “knowledge of the minds of others” is used because of the idea that one has understood.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi rnal 'byor gyi dbang gis rang gi sems nyid gzhan gyi sems dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par gsal bar snang ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi rnal 'byor gyi dbang gis rang gi sems nyid gzhan gyi sems dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par gsal bar snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, by the power of their yoga, their own minds appear as if they were the minds of others.

original: dper na de dag gi rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnam pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de dag gi rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnam pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, by the power of their yoga, a cognition arises that clearly manifests past and future things.

original: de yang de dag gzung ba'i cha la gzhan gyi sems su sems pa na gzhan gyi sems rig go zhes rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de yang de dag gzung ba'i cha la gzhan gyi sems su sems pa na gzhan gyi sems rig go zhes rtog par byed do //
translated: Moreover, when they think that the aspect of the object is the mind of another, they imagine that they know the mind of another.

original: pha rol gyi dpe ma grub par bsams te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi dpe ma grub par bsams te /
translated: The example of the other is not established.

original: de yang ji ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin zhes dris so //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin zhes dris so //
translated: Moreover, how is it not in accordance with fact?

original: gal te rang gi sems shes pa don med pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par grub na ni de'i tshe dper bstan pa yang rigs na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi sems shes pa don med pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par grub na ni de'i tshe dper bstan pa yang rigs na /
translated: If the knowledge of one’s own mind were established as not being just as it is, then at that time the example would be reasonable.

original: de nyid ma grub na ji lta ba bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: de nyid ma grub na ji lta ba bzhin ma yin /
translated: But if that is not established, it is not just as it is.

original: bstan bcos byed pas gnyi ga yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas gnyi ga yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: The treatise writer says that both are reasons for not being just as they are.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The Buddhas” and so forth.

original: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: ji ltar de brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar de brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Just as that is inexpressible” and so forth is said.

original: rang gi sems de dang gzhan gyi sems de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du thugs su chud pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi sems de dang gzhan gyi sems de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du thugs su chud pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That one’s own mind and that other’s mind are just as they are understood by the Bhagavān Buddhas as being of the nature of the inexpressible, and so forth is said.

original: thugs su chud pa de bzhin du srog chags rnams kyis rang gi sems ma rig /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa de bzhin du srog chags rnams kyis rang gi sems ma rig /
translated: Just as they are understood, living beings do not know their own minds.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang gzhan gyi sems mi rig go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang gzhan gyi sems mi rig go //
translated: The yogi also does not know the mind of another.

original: de lta bas na rang gi sems shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyi ga yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi sems shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyi ga yang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of one’s own mind and the knowledge of the minds of others are both not in accordance with fact.

original: srog chags rnams dang / rnal 'byor pas rang dang gzhan gyi sems brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du ci'i phyir ma shes snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: srog chags rnams dang / rnal 'byor pas rang dang gzhan gyi sems brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du ci'i phyir ma shes snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that living beings and yogins do not know the mind as having an inexpressible nature?

original: log par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: log par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it appears falsely.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi sems de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas log pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi sems de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas log pa'o //
translated: Thus, their mind is false in the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i don du na de dag gi sems de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i don du na de dag gi sems de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin na /
translated: In this way, if their mind is free from apprehended object and apprehending subject in an ultimate sense,

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'i sems la gnyis kyi rnam pa ni log pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'i sems la gnyis kyi rnam pa ni log pa yin no //
translated: then the aspect of duality in the mind that has a nondual nature is false.

original: de'i phyir @195a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @195a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: gzung ba'i chas bsgribs pas rang dang gzhan gyi sems kyi ngo bo la srog chags rnams dang / rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems dang gzhan gyi sems brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du ma rig ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i chas bsgribs pas rang dang gzhan gyi sems kyi ngo bo la srog chags rnams dang / rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems dang gzhan gyi sems brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du ma rig ste /
translated: Since the aspect of the object is obscured, living beings do not know the nature of their own minds and the minds of others to be inexpressible.

original: de dag rang gi gzung ba'i cha gnyis rang dang gzhan gyi sems lta bur rig pa na rang dang gzhan gyi sems rig go zhes rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag rang gi gzung ba'i cha gnyis rang dang gzhan gyi sems lta bur rig pa na rang dang gzhan gyi sems rig go zhes rtog par byed kyi /
translated: When they know the two aspects of the object, which are like their own minds and the minds of others, they think, “I know my own mind and the minds of others.”

original: yang dag pa'i don du na rang dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rang gi ngo bo la ni ma reg go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na rang dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rang gi ngo bo la ni ma reg go //
translated: But in reality, they do not touch the nature of their own minds and the minds of others.

original: dper na bum pa'i kha dog 'dra ba'i snam bu zhig gis bum pa g-yogs na mthong /
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i kha dog 'dra ba'i snam bu zhig gis bum pa g-yogs na mthong /
translated: For example, when a cloth, which is like the color of a pot, covers the pot, the pot is seen.

original: snam bu mthong yang srog chags dag bum pa mthong ngo snyam du sems pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: snam bu mthong yang srog chags dag bum pa mthong ngo snyam du sems pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de ltar blta'o //
translated: Although the cloth is seen, living beings think, “I see the pot.” In the same way, it should be understood here.

original: gal te srog chags rnams dang rnal 'byor pa dag gi sems kyi ngo bo gnyis su med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te srog chags rnams dang rnal 'byor pa dag gi sems kyi ngo bo gnyis su med pa yin na /
translated: If the nature of the minds of living beings and the nature of the minds of yogins are nondual,

original: ci'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam par 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam par 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: Why does it arise in the aspect of duality?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “Because of the appearance of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, etc.”

original: 'di ltar de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the non-abandonment of the adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: ji srid du de ma spangs pa de srid du sems kyi ngo bo gnyis su med du zin kyang gnyis kyi rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: ji srid du de ma spangs pa de srid du sems kyi ngo bo gnyis su med du zin kyang gnyis kyi rnam par snang ngo //
translated: as long as that is not abandoned, the mind, although it is not really dual, appears as if it were dual.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam la rgol ba ngan pa'i lan btab bo //🔽ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam la cung zad tsam zhig bshad kyi de rnam pa thams cad du ci'i phyir ma bshad snyam pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam la rgol ba ngan pa'i lan btab bo // ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam la cung zad tsam zhig bshad kyi de rnam pa thams cad du ci'i phyir ma bshad snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the objection against mere representation is answered.🔽Why is mere representation explained only a little, and not in every way?

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “Because of the non-abandonment of the adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject, etc.”

original: gang gis rab tu byed pa rnam par nges pa mtha' yas pa dang / gang gting mi dpogs shing zab pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam de'i rnam par rig pa tsam du 'grub pa gang yin pa de dag gis rang gi nus pa dang mthun par byas kyi /
analyzed: gang gis rab tu byed pa rnam par nges pa mtha' yas pa dang / gang gting mi dpogs shing zab pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam de'i rnam par rig pa tsam du 'grub pa gang yin pa de dag gis rang gi nus pa dang mthun par byas kyi /
translated: By whom the infinite ascertainment of the chapters is made, and by whom the mere representation of consciousness, which is unfathomable and profound, is established.

original: de'i rnam pa kun du ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bsam par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa kun du ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bsam par mi nus te /
translated: All of its aspects cannot be conceived by ordinary beings,

original: 'di ltar de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyod yul kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyod yul kho na'o //
translated: because it is the domain of the Blessed Buddhas alone.

original: bstan bcos byed pas tshigs su bcad pa tha ma'i phyed rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas tshigs su bcad pa tha ma'i phyed rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the latter half of the verse, the author of the treatise says:

original: de'i rnam pa kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: All of its aspects and so on.

original: de kho na ma mthong ba rtog pa'i dra ba ma dral ba bdag 'dra bas rnam par rig pa tsam de'i rnam pa thams cad bsam par mi nus so //
analyzed: de kho na ma mthong ba rtog pa'i dra ba ma dral ba bdag 'dra bas rnam par rig pa tsam de'i rnam pa thams cad bsam par mi nus so //
translated: One like me, who has not seen reality and whose net of concepts has not been removed, cannot conceive all the aspects of mere representation of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because it is not the domain of speculation.

original: 'di ltar don dam pa ni rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa ni rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the ultimate is not the domain of speculation.

original: bsam pa ni rtog ge'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni rtog ge'o //
translated: Speculation is thought.

original: de bas na de bsam par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na de bsam par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be thought.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam ni don dam pa yin na ji ltar rtog ge'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam ni don dam pa yin na ji ltar rtog ge'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: If the mere representation is the ultimate, how can it be the domain of speculation?

original: @195b gal te de kho na ma mthong ba dag gis rnam pa thams cad bsam par mi nus na de rnam pa thams cad du su'i spyod yul snyam pa la /
analyzed: @195b gal te de kho na ma mthong ba dag gis rnam pa thams cad bsam par mi nus na de rnam pa thams cad du su'i spyod yul snyam pa la /
translated: If those who do not see reality cannot think of it in any way, whose domain is it in every way?

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul lo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul lo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is the domain of the Buddha.

original: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid dgrol ba'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to explain just that, he says, “The Buddha, etc. ”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud de /🔽de bas na de dag gi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud de / de bas na de dag gi spyod yul lo //
translated: The Buddhas, the Exalted Ones, have understood it in every way.🔽Therefore, it is their domain.

original: de ci'i phyir de dag gi spyod yul snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de dag gi spyod yul snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it their domain?

original: shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la mkhyen pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la mkhyen pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they have unobstructed knowledge of all aspects of all objects of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa'i gtsug gi nor bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa ni shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa'i gtsug gi nor bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa ni shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the crest jewels of yogis, is unobstructed with regard to all aspects of all objects of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du de dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po thams cad mngon sum du mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du de dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po thams cad mngon sum du mdzad do //
translated: Thus, like a myrobalan fruit placed in the palm of the hand, they perceive all mundane and supramundane things.

original: de bas na de dag gang la yang thogs par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gang la yang thogs par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could they be obstructed by anything?

original: 'di ltar shes bya la sgrib par byed pa'i thogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya la sgrib par byed pa'i thogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have abandoned the obstruction that obscures objects of knowledge.

original: nyi shu pa ni rnam phye bas //
analyzed: nyi shu pa ni rnam phye bas //
translated: The twentieth is the analysis of

original: bdag gi dge ba kha ba dang // zla ba'i zer 'dra gang thob des //
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba kha ba dang // zla ba'i zer 'dra gang thob des //
translated: my virtues, which are like the rays of the moon and snow.

original: 'gro ba sangs rgyas grub par shog / nus la ltos te bgyis pas na //🔽mi shes dbang gis cung zad du //
analyzed: 'gro ba sangs rgyas grub par shog / nus la ltos te bgyis pas na // mi shes dbang gis cung zad du //
translated: Since I have composed this according to my ability,

original: mi 'drar bshad bar gyur na yang //
analyzed: mi 'drar bshad bar gyur na yang //
translated: if there are some errors due to my ignorance,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod //🔽rab tu byed pa nyi shu ba'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod // rab tu byed pa nyi shu ba'i 'grel bshad /
translated: may the learned be patient with them.

original: slob dpon dul ba'i lhas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon dul ba'i lhas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twentieth chapter, on the perfections, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.🔽This was composed by the master Vinītadeva.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Śīlendrabodhi, the translator-editor Ga-ma-pa Ye-shay-day, and others.
